original: @26b * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @26b * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aa bhi dharmma ko sham bh'a shyam /
analyzed: aa bhi dharmma ko sham bh'a shyam /
translated: Abhidharmako≈õabhƒÅ·π£yam

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi bshad pa /üîΩ'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi bshad pa / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Explanation of the Treasury of AbhidharmaüîΩHomage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´

original: gang zhig kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhing //
translated: Homage to him who has utterly destroyed darkness everywhere

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
translated: and who has pulled out the world from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having paid homage to him, the teacher of truth,

original: chos mngon mdzod kyi bstan bcos rab bshad bya //
analyzed: chos mngon mdzod kyi bstan bcos rab bshad bya //
translated: I will explain the treatise on the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas rang gi ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir de la yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba rtsom mo //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas rang gi ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir de la yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba rtsom mo //
translated: One who wishes to compose a treatise first composes a homage that precedes the expression of qualities in order to understand the greatness of one's own teacher.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase whoever

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
translated: refers to the Blessed Buddha.

original: 'di'i 'am 'dis mun pa bcom bas mun pa bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'am 'dis mun pa bcom bas mun pa bcom pa'o //
translated: He is called the destroyer of darkness because he has destroyed or because he has this darkness.

original: thams cad la mun pa rnam pa thams cad du bcom pas kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la mun pa rnam pa thams cad du bcom pas kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
translated: Since he has completely destroyed darkness in every way, he has completely destroyed darkness everywhere.

original: mi shes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir mun pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir mun pa ste /
translated: Darkness is ignorance, because it is an obstruction to seeing the truth.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyen po brnyes nas shes bya thams cad la phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir gtan nas ye bcom pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyen po brnyes nas shes bya thams cad la phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir gtan nas ye bcom pa ste /
translated: Since the Lord Buddha has obtained the antidote, it is completely destroyed for him, because it will not arise again with respect to any object of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i ni kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i ni kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he has completely destroyed darkness everywhere.

original: de rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir kun la mun pa bcom par ni 'dod mod kyi gtan nas ni ma yin te 'di ltar de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / yul dang /
analyzed: de rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir kun la mun pa bcom par ni 'dod mod kyi gtan nas ni ma yin te 'di ltar de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / yul dang /
translated: It is accepted that the Solitary Realizers and Hearers have destroyed darkness everywhere, because they are free from afflicted ignorance. However, it is not completely destroyed, because they have not abandoned the obscurations to omniscience.

original: dus shin tu bskal pa dang / don rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pa nyid do //üîΩde ltar bdag la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par bstod nas /
analyzed: dus shin tu bskal pa dang / don rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pa nyid do // de ltar bdag la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par bstod nas /
translated: There is non-defiled nescience with regard to the extremely long time and the infinite divisions of meaning.üîΩHaving thus praised the Lord with a perfect benefit for self,

original: yang bcom ldan 'das de nyid la gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par bstod pa ni /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das de nyid la gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par bstod pa ni /
translated: he praises him again with a perfect benefit for others:

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: You have pulled out the world from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba ni 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / brgal bar dka' ba'i phyir 'dam lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / brgal bar dka' ba'i phyir 'dam lta bu yin te /
translated: Cyclic existence is like a mire, because it is the abode of the attachment of all beings and because it is difficult to cross.

original: 'gro ba der bying ba skyabs med pa la bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba dang ldan pas @27a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba der bying ba skyabs med pa la bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba dang ldan pas @27a * //
translated: The Lord, with compassion for those beings who have sunk into it and have no protector,

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa'i phyag brkyang ba dag gis skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du drangs so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa'i phyag brkyang ba dag gis skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du drangs so //
translated: has pulled them out according to their lot with the outstretched hand of the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin phyin ci ma log par ston pas na don bzhin ston pa'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin phyin ci ma log par ston pas na don bzhin ston pa'o //
translated: He teaches the meaning just as it is, without distortion, thus he teaches in accordance with the meaning.

original: 'dis ni 'di'i gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: This shows the means by which he accomplishes the welfare of others.

original: de ni ston pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ston pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus ni ma yin no //
translated: When he teaches, he teaches in accordance with reality, thus he delivers beings from the swamp of cyclic existence, not through the power of his magical abilities or his gifts of the sacred articles.üîΩHaving paid homage to him who is endowed with such an excellent accomplishment of the welfare of self and others, with his head, he then says, I will explain the treatise.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni mgos btud nas so don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni mgos btud nas so don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What does he do after paying homage to him who teaches in accordance with the meaning?

original: bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, I will explain the treatise.

original: slob ma 'chos pas na bstan bcos so //
analyzed: slob ma 'chos pas na bstan bcos so //
translated: It is a treatise because it disciplines the disciple.

original: bstan bcos gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the treatise?

original: chos mngon mdzod ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos mngon mdzod ces bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhe na /
translated: What is this called Abhidharma?

original: chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /üîΩde la shes rab ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas // zhes bya ba ste / de la shes rab ces bya ba ni /
translated: The Abhidharma is stainless wisdom together with its following.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Here, wisdom is the discernment of phenomena.

original: dri med ces bya ba ni gang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dri med ces bya ba ni gang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Stainless means without impurity.

original: rjes 'brang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rjes 'brang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Together with its following means together with its retinue.

original: de ltar na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga po la chos mngon pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga po la chos mngon pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the five pure aggregates are called the Abhidharma.

original: de zhig 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: de zhig 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mngon pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate Abhidharma.

original: brdar btags pa ni /
analyzed: brdar btags pa ni /
translated: The conventional is:

original: de thob bya'i phyir gang dang bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de thob bya'i phyir gang dang bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: that which is to be attained, and the treatise.

original: gang dang zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab gang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / skyes nas thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab gang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / skyes nas thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which is to be attained is the wisdom arisen from hearing, reflection, and meditation, together with its following, which is accompanied by impurity and obtained from birth.

original: bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba ni de yang zag pa med pa'i shes rab thob par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshogs su gyur pas chos mngon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba ni de yang zag pa med pa'i shes rab thob par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshogs su gyur pas chos mngon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The treatise is called Abhidharma because it is the collection of that knowledge, in order to obtain uncontaminated wisdom.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos te /
translated: In etymologizing the term, dharma is that which holds its own characteristics.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa 'am /
translated: Thus, it is the ultimate truth, nirvana, or

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir chos mngon pa'o //
translated: it is Abhidharma because it is directed toward the characteristics of dharmas.

original: chos mngon pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos mngon pa bshad zin to //
translated: The Abhidharma has been explained.

original: bstan bcos 'di ji ltar na chos mngon pa'i mdzod @27b yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ji ltar na chos mngon pa'i mdzod @27b yin zhe na /
translated: How is this treatise a treasury of the Abhidharma?

original: 'dir de don du yang dag chud phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dir de don du yang dag chud phyir ram /
translated: Because it is the true collection of its meaning

original: 'di yi gnas de yin pas chos mngon mdzod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di yi gnas de yin pas chos mngon mdzod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: or because it is the basis of that, it is called the treasury of the Abhidharma.

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos zhes bya ba de ji ltar gces gces rnams don du 'dir chud de /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos zhes bya ba de ji ltar gces gces rnams don du 'dir chud de /
translated: The treatise called Abhidharma is the true collection of the meaning of the precious gems of the Abhidharma.

original: de lta bas na bstan bcos 'di ni de'i mdzod lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bstan bcos 'di ni de'i mdzod lta bu yin no //
translated: Thus, this treatise is like a treasury of that Abhidharma.

original: yang na de las 'di phyung bas chos mngon pa de bstan bcos 'di'i gnas lta bu yin no /üîΩde'i phyir chos mngon pa de nyid 'di'i mdzod yin te /
analyzed: yang na de las 'di phyung bas chos mngon pa de bstan bcos 'di'i gnas lta bu yin no / de'i phyir chos mngon pa de nyid 'di'i mdzod yin te /
translated: Or else, since this treatise is drawn from Abhidharma, Abhidharma is like the location of this treatise.üîΩTherefore, Abhidharma is the treasury of this treatise.

original: de lta bas na bstan bcos 'di ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bstan bcos 'di ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin no //
translated: Thus, this treatise is the treasury of Abhidharma.

original: yang ci'i phyir chos mngon pa bstan /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir chos mngon pa bstan /
translated: Why was Abhidharma taught?

original: 'di dang po nyid du sus bstan na /
analyzed: 'di dang po nyid du sus bstan na /
translated: Who taught it in the first place?

original: 'di ltar slob dpon chos mngon pa'i mdzod 'chad par gus she na /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon chos mngon pa'i mdzod 'chad par gus she na /
translated: Why do you, the master, respect the explanation of the treasury of Abhidharma?

original: chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams /
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams /
translated: Because without the discernment of phenomena,

original: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
analyzed: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
translated: there is no means to pacify the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pas kyang 'jig rten srid mtsho 'dir 'khyams te //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kyang 'jig rten srid mtsho 'dir 'khyams te //
translated: And because of the afflictions, the world wanders in this ocean of existence.

original: de bas de phyir 'di ni ston pas gsungs so lo //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas de phyir 'di ni ston pas gsungs so lo // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the Teacher taught Abhidharma.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med par nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med par nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
translated: Because without the discernment of phenomena, there is no means to pacify the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po 'dir 'khyam par byed pa de'i phyir chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'dod pa de'i don du ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa gsungs so lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po 'dir 'khyam par byed pa de'i phyir chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'dod pa de'i don du ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa gsungs so lo //
translated: Also, the afflictions cause one to wander in this great ocean of cyclic existence. Therefore, the Teacher, the Bhagavan Buddha, taught the Abhidharma in order to analyze phenomena for those who desire to do so.

original: chos mngon pa bstan pa med par ni slob mas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa bstan pa med par ni slob mas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed par mi nus so //
translated: Without the teaching of the Abhidharma, disciples are unable to analyze phenomena.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sil bur bshad la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sil bur bshad la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: The Bhagavan taught the Abhidharma in fragments.

original: btsun pa k'a ty'a'i bu la sogs pas bsdus nas bzhag ste /
analyzed: btsun pa k'a ty'a'i bu la sogs pas bsdus nas bzhag ste /
translated: Venerable Katyayana and others compiled it and established it.

original: btsun pa chos skyob kyis ched du brjod pa'i sde /
analyzed: btsun pa chos skyob kyis ched du brjod pa'i sde /
translated: Venerable Dharmatrata compiled the Udanavarga.

original: sde tshan du byas pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sde tshan du byas pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like that.

original: gang dag chos mngon pa bstan pas rab tu rnam par dbye par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag chos mngon pa bstan pas rab tu rnam par dbye par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that are to be analyzed by the teaching of the Abhidharma?

original: zag bcas zag pa med chos rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zag bcas zag pa med chos rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena.

original: 'di ni chos rnams thams cad mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams thams cad mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of all factors.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the factors with fluxes?

original: lam ma gtogs pa 'dus byas @28a * //üîΩrnams // zag bcas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lam ma gtogs pa 'dus byas @28a * // rnams // zag bcas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The conditioned factors, with the exception of the path, are with fluxes.

original: lam gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The conditioned factors, with the exception of the truth of the path, are with fluxes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?üîΩBecause the fluxes

original: gang phyir de dag la //üîΩzag rnams kun tu rgyas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang phyir de dag la // zag rnams kun tu rgyas par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: increase in them.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the conditioned factors, with the exception of the path.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la dmigs pas kyang zag pa skye bar ni 'dod mod kyi //üîΩde gnyis la rgyas par mi 'gyur bas de gnyis zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la dmigs pas kyang zag pa skye bar ni 'dod mod kyi // de gnyis la rgyas par mi 'gyur bas de gnyis zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba med do //
translated: The fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.

original: ji ltar rgyas par mi 'gyur ba de ni 'og nas phra rgyas bstan pa nyid du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyas par mi 'gyur ba de ni 'og nas phra rgyas bstan pa nyid du bstan par bya'o //
translated: The fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dag bshad zin to //
translated: The fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.

original: zag pa med pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: The fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.üîΩThe fluxes increase in the factors which are their basis.

original: zag med lam gyi bden pa dang // 'dus ma byas rnam gsum yang ste //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zag med lam gyi bden pa dang // 'dus ma byas rnam gsum yang ste // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The truth of the path which is uncontaminated, and the three types of unconditioned things.

original: rnam gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of unconditioned things?

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Space and the two types of cessation.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two types of cessation?

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: Cessation through deliberation and cessation not through deliberation.

original: de ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum po de dang / lam gyi bden pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum po de dang / lam gyi bden pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: Thus, the unconditioned things such as space, and the truth of the path, are the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: de dag la zag pa rgyas par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de dag la zag pa rgyas par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the contaminants do not increase in regard to them.

original: 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum po bstan pa gang yin pa de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum po bstan pa gang yin pa de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa /
translated: The three types of unconditioned things that have been presented are as follows: Space is non-obstruction.

original: nam mkha' ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin te gang na gzugs kyi go yod pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin te gang na gzugs kyi go yod pa'o //
translated: Space has the nature of non-obstruction, where form can be present.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Cessation through deliberation is separation.

original: gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the dharmas that are subject to cankers is called cessation through deliberation.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste shes rab kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste shes rab kyi bye brag go //
translated: The discernment of the truths of suffering, etc. is deliberation, a particular kind of knowledge.

original: des thob par bya ba'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: des thob par bya ba'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation that is to be attained by that is cessation through deliberation.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par bya ba ste /
translated: The middle term is elided.

original: dper na ba lang dag dang ldan pa'i shing rta la ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dag dang ldan pa'i shing rta la ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a cart yoked to oxen is called an ox-cart.

original: ci zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gcig kho na 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gcig kho na 'am zhe na /
translated: Is there only one cessation through deliberation for all dharmas that are subject to cankers?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: No, it is said.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How then?

original: so so so so yin /
analyzed: so so so so yin /
translated: Each has its own.

original: ldan @28b pa'i rdzas rnams ji snyed pa bral ba'i rdzas rnams kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: ldan @28b pa'i rdzas rnams ji snyed pa bral ba'i rdzas rnams kyang de snyed do //
translated: There are as many substances of separation as there are substances of possession.

original: de lta ma yin na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas nyon mongs pa thams cad 'gos pa mngon sum du byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas nyon mongs pa thams cad 'gos pa mngon sum du byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then by realizing the cessation of the defilements to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, one would realize the cessation of all defilements.

original: de lta ma yin na lhag ma'i gnyen po bsgom pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na lhag ma'i gnyen po bsgom pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then the cultivation of the counteragents to the remaining categories of defilements would be pointless.

original: 'o na 'gog pa ni 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa 'di'i don ji lta bu yin zhe na /üîΩtshig de'i don ni 'di 'dra ba'i rgyu gang yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na 'gog pa ni 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa 'di'i don ji lta bu yin zhe na / tshig de'i don ni 'di 'dra ba'i rgyu gang yang ma yin la /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúCessation is not similar‚Äù?üîΩThe meaning of that statement is that it is not a cause similar to any other,

original: 'di yang gang gi 'dra ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gang gi 'dra ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: and that it is not a cause similar to any other.

original: 'di la 'dra ba gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'dra ba gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not similar to anything at all.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa bshad zin to //
translated: The cessation that is attained by analysis has been explained.

original: skye la gtan du bgegs byed pa /
analyzed: skye la gtan du bgegs byed pa /
translated: The other cessation is the permanent obstruction of arising.

original: 'gog gzhan so sor brtags min pas //
analyzed: 'gog gzhan so sor brtags min pas //
translated: The other cessation is nonanalytical.

original: chos ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la gtan du bgegs su gyur pa bral ba las gzhan pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: chos ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la gtan du bgegs su gyur pa bral ba las gzhan pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: That is nonanalytical cessation.

original: 'di so sor brtags pas 'thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di so sor brtags pas 'thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not obtained by analysis.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rkyen ma tshang ba las thob ste /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba las thob ste /
translated: It is obtained through the noncompletion of conditions.

original: dper na mig dang yid gzugs gcig la yengs pa'i gzugs gzhan pa rnams dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya gang yin pa dag ni 'das par 'gyur la /üîΩde dag la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni yang skye bar yang mi nus te /
analyzed: dper na mig dang yid gzugs gcig la yengs pa'i gzugs gzhan pa rnams dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya gang yin pa dag ni 'das par 'gyur la / de dag la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni yang skye bar yang mi nus te /
translated: For example, when the eye and mind are distracted to one form, other forms, and also sound, smell, taste, and tactility that are present become past.

original: de dag 'das pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'das pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five collections of consciousness that focus on them are unable to arise again because they lack the power to focus on past objects.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa de ni rkyen ma tshang bas 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa de ni rkyen ma tshang bas 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore their nonanalytical cessation is obtained through the noncompletion of conditions.

original: 'dir mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Here there are four possibilities.

original: gang dag gis so sor brtags pas 'gog pha kho na 'thob pa'i chos de dag kyang yod de //
analyzed: gang dag gis so sor brtags pas 'gog pha kho na 'thob pa'i chos de dag kyang yod de //
translated: There are factors that one obtains only through analytical cessation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'byung ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'byung ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: those that are past and present, and that are subject to arising.

original: gang dag gis so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa kho na 'thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag gis so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa kho na 'thob pa yang yod de /
translated: There are factors that one obtains only through non-analytical cessation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: those that are unconditioned and unarisen.

original: gang dag gis gnyi ga 'thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag gis gnyi ga 'thob pa yang yod de /
translated: There are factors that one obtains through both.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o /
translated: those that are conditioned and unarisen.

original: @29a * // gang dag gis gnyi ga mi 'thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: @29a * // gang dag gis gnyi ga mi 'thob pa yang yod de /
translated: There are factors that one obtains through neither.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zag pa med pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'byung ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'byung ba'i chos can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: those that are past and present, and that are subject to arising.

original: 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
translated: The three types of unconditioned factors have been explained.

original: lam ma gtogs pa 'dus byas rnams //
analyzed: lam ma gtogs pa 'dus byas rnams //
translated: The conditioned factors are the factors other than the path.

original: zag bcas zhes gang smras pa'i 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na /üîΩ'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
analyzed: zag bcas zhes gang smras pa'i 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na / 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
translated: What are the conditioned factors?

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga //
translated: The conditioned factors are the five aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The five aggregates are the aggregate of material form, the aggregate of sensation, the aggregate of ideation, the aggregate of the formations, the aggregate of consciousness.

original: rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa dag na 'dus byas rnams te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa dag na 'dus byas rnams te /
translated: The conditioned factors are so called because they are produced by the coming together of causes and conditions.

original: rkyen gcig gis bskyed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rkyen gcig gis bskyed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is not a single factor that is produced by a single cause.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dag la yang mi 'gal te 'o ma dang shing bzhin no //üîΩde dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung ba gzhi dang bcas //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dag la yang mi 'gal te 'o ma dang shing bzhin no // de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung ba gzhi dang bcas //
translated: The future factors, although not yet arisen, are not in contradiction with the definition of conditioned factors, because they will be, or because they are of the same type as the factors that will be.üîΩThe aggregates, the sense spheres and the elements are the conditioned factors.

original: de dag nyid ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The aggregates, the sense spheres and the elements are the conditioned factors.

original: song ba dang 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: song ba dang 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
translated: because one has gone, is going, and will go,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis za ba'i phyir dus rnams so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis za ba'i phyir dus rnams so //
translated: or because the three times are consumed by impermanence.

original: gtam ni ngag go //
analyzed: gtam ni ngag go //
translated: Discourse is speech.

original: de'i gzhi ni ming ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni ming ste /
translated: Its basis is name,

original: don dang bcas pa'i gzhi smos pa'i phyir na 'dus byas ni gtam gyi gzhi zhes bya'o //üîΩde lta ma yin na rab tu byed pa las /
analyzed: don dang bcas pa'i gzhi smos pa'i phyir na 'dus byas ni gtam gyi gzhi zhes bya'o // de lta ma yin na rab tu byed pa las /
translated: because it is said that the basis is meaningful, therefore conditioned states are said to be the basis of discourse.üîΩIf that were not so, it would contradict the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma, which states:

original: gtam gyi gzhi rnams ni khams bco brgyad kyis bsdus so zhes 'byung ba'i gzhung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtam gyi gzhi rnams ni khams bco brgyad kyis bsdus so zhes 'byung ba'i gzhung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The basis of discourse is subsumed by the eighteen elements.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Undoubtedly occurring is definitely occurring.

original: 'dus byas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the definite occurrence of all conditioned states.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas nges par 'byung bcas dag go //
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas nges par 'byung bcas dag go //
translated: Since it exists for them, they possess definite occurrence.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir gzhi dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir gzhi dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: They possess a basis because they possess a cause.üîΩThe term basis is a word for cause,

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i tshig yin lo /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i tshig yin lo /
translated: say the Vaibhasikas.

original: de ltar na de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos kyi rnam grangs dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos kyi rnam grangs dag yin no //
translated: These are the different categories of conditioned factors.

original: yang 'dus byas de dag nyid /
analyzed: yang 'dus byas de dag nyid /
translated: The same conditioned factors are also:

original: gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
translated: The appropriated aggregates, which are impure.

original: phung po'ang de dag /'dis ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phung po'ang de dag /'dis ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of this new presentation?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga gang dag yin pa de dag ni phung po yang yin no //üîΩphung po dag kho na yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po @29b ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga gang dag yin pa de dag ni phung po yang yin no // phung po dag kho na yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po @29b ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: The five aggregates which are appropriated are also aggregates.üîΩBut there are aggregates which are not appropriated aggregates.

original: 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams so //üîΩde la nye bar len pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams so // de la nye bar len pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The uncontaminated factors are aggregates, but not appropriated aggregates.üîΩThe appropriators are the defilements.

original: de dag las byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po dag ste /
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po dag ste /
translated: The aggregates are called appropriated because they arise from the defilements,

original: dper na rtsva dang sog ma'i me bzhin pa 'am /
analyzed: dper na rtsva dang sog ma'i me bzhin pa 'am /
translated: like a grass fire or a straw fire.üîΩOr else, the aggregates are called appropriated because the defilements depend on them,

original: de dag la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyal po'i mi bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyal po'i mi bzhin no //
translated: like a king‚Äôs men.

original: yang na de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
analyzed: yang na de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
translated: Or else, the aggregates are called appropriated because the appropriator is found in them,üîΩlike a treasure hidden in a house.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing ljon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing ljon pa bzhin no //
translated: like a tree with flowers and fruits.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos de dag nyid /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos de dag nyid /
translated: These same dharmas with asrava

original: 'thab bcas kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'thab bcas kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: are also called ‚Äúwith conflict.

original: 'thab pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'thab pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: ‚Äù Conflict is the defilements,

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they harm oneself and others.

original: de dag gis rgyas par byas pa'i phyir 'thab bcas dag ste zag pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gis rgyas par byas pa'i phyir 'thab bcas dag ste zag pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: They are called ‚Äúwith conflict‚Äù because they are nourished by that conflict, like ‚Äúwith asrava.üîΩ‚Äù They are also suffering, the origin of suffering, the world,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha gnas srid pa'ang de dag yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha gnas srid pa'ang de dag yin //
translated: and the abode of beings.

original: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: They are suffering because they are contrary to the noble ones.

original: 'di las sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are the origin of suffering because suffering originates from them.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig rten no //
translated: They are the world because they are destroyed.

original: 'di la lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gnas pas na lta ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'di la lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gnas pas na lta ba'i gnas so //
translated: They are the abode of views because views increase through them.

original: 'byung bas na srid pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung bas na srid pa ste /
translated: They are existence because they exist.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam grangs don dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam grangs don dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: Thus these are the synonyms of dharmas with asrava, which correspond to their meaning.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga //üîΩzhes smras pa de la /üîΩgzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga // zhes smras pa de la / gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
translated: The five aggregates are form and so on.

original: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid //
analyzed: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid //
translated: The five sense faculties, the five objects, and imperceptible form.

original: dbang po lnga po mig dang rna ba dang // sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams dang / don lnga po mig la sogs pa rnams de dag nyid kyi yul gang dag yin pa gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang /üîΩro dang / reg bya rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste de snyed cig ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po mig dang rna ba dang // sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams dang / don lnga po mig la sogs pa rnams de dag nyid kyi yul gang dag yin pa gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste de snyed cig ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The five sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties. The five objects are the visible form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible-object sense-spheres that are the objects of those faculties.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: Imperceptible form is just that. That much is the form aggregate.

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
translated: The consciousness aggregate is the six consciousnesses.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
translated: The six consciousnesses are eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mental consciousness.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang /
translated: The five that are the basis of the consciousness of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility are, respectively, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.üîΩ

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus dag yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus dag yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five that are the basis of the consciousnesses of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility are, respectively, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: bcom ldan 'das @30a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @30a * //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said,

original: kyis ji skad du dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched de /
analyzed: kyis ji skad du dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched de /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the eye is an internal sense base,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs dang ba'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs dang ba'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: which is subtle form derived from the four great elements.‚Äù

original: yang na mig la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: Or, the eye and so on that are mentioned

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
translated: are the basis of the consciousnesses of those.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
translated: The eye and so on are clear form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: They are the basis of eye consciousness and so on.

original: de ltar bshad na rab tu byed pa las //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na rab tu byed pa las //
translated: If this is explained in that way, then the treatise Attainment of Knowledge asks,

original: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the eye faculty?‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i gzhung dang yang mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i gzhung dang yang mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: The text continues: ‚ÄúThe eye sense-faculty is the subtle matter which is the support of the visual consciousness.‚Äù

original: dbang po lnga dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dag bshad zin to //
translated: The five sense-faculties have been discussed.

original: don lnga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: don lnga bshad par bya ste /
translated: The five objects will now be discussed.

original: de la re zhig / gzugs rnam gnyis dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gzugs rnam gnyis dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs so //
translated: The visible form is twofold: color and shape.

original: de la kha dog ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la kha dog ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Color is fourfold:

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white.

original: gzhan dag ni de'i bye brag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de'i bye brag go //
translated: The other colors are subdivisions of these four.

original: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Shape is eightfold:

original: ring po la sogs pa nas phya le ba ma yin pa la thug pa'o //üîΩyang gzugs kyi skye mched de nyid /
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa nas phya le ba ma yin pa la thug pa'o // yang gzugs kyi skye mched de nyid /
translated: long, short, square, round, high, low, soft, hard.

original: rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: This visible form is also said to be of twenty varieties:üîΩblue, yellow, red, white, long, short, square, round, high, low, soft, hard,

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: smooth, rough, shining, cloudy, shaded, bright, light, dark.

original: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'o //
analyzed: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'o //
translated: darkness.

original: kha cig ni nam mkha' la kha dog gcig dang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'don to //
analyzed: kha cig ni nam mkha' la kha dog gcig dang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'don to //
translated: Some read: ‚Äúin the sky, one color, twenty-one aspects.‚Äù

original: de la phya le ba ni dbyibs mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de la phya le ba ni dbyibs mnyam pa'o //
translated: Evenness is a uniform shape.

original: phya le ba ma yin pa ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: phya le ba ma yin pa ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Unevenness is an irregular shape.

original: khug rna ni lho bur ro //
analyzed: khug rna ni lho bur ro //
translated: Fog is mist.

original: nyi ma ni nyi ma'i 'od do //
analyzed: nyi ma ni nyi ma'i 'od do //
translated: Sunlight is the light of the sun.

original: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od dag go //
analyzed: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od dag go //
translated: Light is the light of the moon, stars, fire, gems, and herbs.

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
translated: Shadow is where forms are visible.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is darkness.

original: lhag ma ni brda phrad par sla bas rnam par ma phye ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni brda phrad par sla bas rnam par ma phye ba'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand and do not need to be explained.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog tu yod la dbyibs su med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog tu yod la dbyibs su med pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a form base that exists as color but not as shape.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: light, shadow, sun, cloud.

original: dbyibs su yod la kha dog @30b tu med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dbyibs su yod la kha dog @30b tu med pa yang yod de /
translated: There is shape that is not color.

original: ring po la sogs pa'i phyogs lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i phyogs lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the shape of the body, long, etc., which is the nature of informative action.

original: gnyi gar yod pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi gar yod pa yang yod de /
translated: There is shape that is also color.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched lhag ma'o //
translated: It is the remaining sense-sphere of visible form.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang ring po la sogs par yongs su chad par snang bas na nyi ma dang / snang ba kho na kha dog tu yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang ring po la sogs par yongs su chad par snang bas na nyi ma dang / snang ba kho na kha dog tu yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Light and shadow are only color, because they are perceived as blue, etc., and long, etc.

original: ji ltar na rdzas gcig la gnyi gar yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rdzas gcig la gnyi gar yod ce na /
translated: How can both exist in one substance?

original: de la gnyi ga mngon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gnyi ga mngon pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because both are evident in it.

original: yod pa 'di ni shes pa'i don yin gyi yod pa'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa 'di ni shes pa'i don yin gyi yod pa'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: This existence is the object of consciousness, not the object of existence.

original: 'o na ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed la'ang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed la'ang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, the same would follow for the informative action of the body.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bshad zin to //
translated: The sense-sphere of visible form has been discussed.

original: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad yod de //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad yod de //
translated: Sound is of eight types.

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba sems can dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba sems can dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Sound is the effect of the great elements which are either grasped or not grasped. It is either indicative of sentient beings or non-indicative of sentient beings. Thus there are four types.

original: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro//üîΩde la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro// de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Sound is pleasant or unpleasant. Thus there are eight types.

original: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o //üîΩma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o // ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Sound is the effect of the great elements which are grasped when it is produced by effort, such as the sound of clapping or the sound of the voice.

original: rlung dang / nags tshal dang / chu'i sgra lta bu'o //üîΩsems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: rlung dang / nags tshal dang / chu'i sgra lta bu'o // sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
translated: Sound is the effect of the great elements which are not grasped when it is produced without effort, such as the sound of the wind, the forest, or water.üîΩSound is indicative of sentient beings when it is speech.

original: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Sound is not indicative of sentient beings in all other cases.

original: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyus las byung ba'i sgra yang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyus las byung ba'i sgra yang yod de /
translated: Others say: Sound also exists that is derived from the great elements that are and are not grasped,

original: dper na lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las skyes pa lta bu'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: dper na lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las skyes pa lta bu'o zhes zer te /
translated: for example, sound that arises from the contact of the hand and drum.

original: de ni 'di ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig las byung ba bzhi tshan gnyis rgyur byas par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mi 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig las byung ba bzhi tshan gnyis rgyur byas par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mi 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is not accepted that a single subtle particle of form is derived from two sets of four primary elements, so it should not be accepted that sound is derived from the great elements that are and are not grasped.

original: sgra bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra bshad zin to //
translated: Sound has been explained.

original: ro ni rnam pa drug //
analyzed: ro ni rnam pa drug //
translated: Taste is of six types.

original: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: It is differentiated by the six types of taste: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: dri rnam bzhi //
analyzed: dri rnam bzhi //
translated: Smell is of four types.

original: dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba rnam pa gnyis /
translated: Pleasant smell and unpleasant smell are each of two types:

original: dri mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: equal and unequal.

original: bstan bcos las ni dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba dang / dri mnyam pa'o zhes rnam pa gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba dang / dri mnyam pa'o zhes rnam pa gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge mentions three types: pleasant smell, unpleasant smell, and equal smell.

original: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do //
analyzed: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do //
translated: Touch is of eleven types.

original: reg bya rdzas kyi rang bzhin ni bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: reg bya rdzas kyi rang bzhin ni bcu gcig ste /
translated: The substance of the tangible consists of eleven types.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / @31a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / @31a * //
translated: The four great elements and smoothness,

original: rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
translated: roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: de la 'byung ba rnams ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba rnams ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The great elements will be explained later.

original: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyen pa'o //
translated: Smoothness is softness.

original: rtsub pa nyid ni rud rud pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid ni rud rud pa'o //
translated: Roughness is roughness.

original: lci ba nyid ni gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: lci ba nyid ni gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o ;
translated: Heaviness is that by which things are weighed.

original: / bzlog pa ni yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: / bzlog pa ni yang ba nyid do //
translated: Lightness is the opposite.

original: grang ba ni dro bar 'dod par byed pa'o //üîΩbkres pa ni zad 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba ni dro bar 'dod par byed pa'o // bkres pa ni zad 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Cold is that which causes the desire for warmth.üîΩHunger is that which causes the desire for food.

original: skom pa ni skom 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa ni skom 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Thirst is that which causes the desire for drink.üîΩThe cause is figuratively designated by the name of the result,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu brtags pa'i phyir te dper na /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu brtags pa'i phyir te dper na /
translated: as for example,

original: sangs rgyas rnams na 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams na 'byung ba bde //
translated: the appearance of the Buddhas is happiness,

original: chos bstan pa yang bde pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the Dharma is happiness,

original: dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba yin //
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba yin //
translated: the harmony of the Sa·πÖgha is happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //üîΩzhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde // zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The ascetics are happy when they are in agreement.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams na ni bkres pa dang skom pa med do //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams na ni bkres pa dang skom pa med do //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there is no hunger or thirst;

original: lhag ma ni yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni yod do //
translated: the rest is as in the realm of desire.

original: gal te de ni gos re re nas mi 'jal yang bsags pa dag ni 'jal lo //
analyzed: gal te de ni gos re re nas mi 'jal yang bsags pa dag ni 'jal lo //
translated: Even though the sentient beings of the realm of fine-materiality do not experience the cold of a freezing wind, they do experience the cold of rain.

original: gnod par byed pa'i grang ba med kyi phan par byed pa ni yod do lo //üîΩgang 'di gzugs rnam ba mang po bshad pa de la res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed de /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i grang ba med kyi phan par byed pa ni yod do lo // gang 'di gzugs rnam ba mang po bshad pa de la res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed de /
translated: The sentient beings of the realm of fine-materiality do not experience the cold that is harmful, but they do experience the cold that is favorable.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from one or many real entities.

original: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //üîΩres 'ga' ni mang pos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o // res 'ga' ni mang pos te /
translated: Sometimes, the eye consciousness arises from one real entity of visible form, when the consciousness distinguishes the particular characteristics of the visible form.

original: gang gi tshe bye brag tu mi gcod pa na ste ;üîΩdper na thag ring po nas dmag bshams pa 'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bye brag tu mi gcod pa na ste ; dper na thag ring po nas dmag bshams pa 'am /
translated: Sometimes, it arises from many real entities, when the consciousness does not distinguish the particular characteristics of the visible form.

original: nor bu'i tshogs kyi kha dog dang dbyibs du ma la lta ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i tshogs kyi kha dog dang dbyibs du ma la lta ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one sees from afar the arrangement of an army or the various colors and shapes of a collection of jewels.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the ear consciousness.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni kha cig na re shin tu mang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang ; 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gcig dang reg bya lngas skyed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni kha cig na re shin tu mang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang ; 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gcig dang reg bya lngas skyed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: If many, then the body sense faculty arises from five tangible objects, i.e., the four primary elements and one type of tangible, smoothness, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re bcu gcig po thams cad kyis kyang skyed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcu gcig po thams cad kyis kyang skyed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It arises from all eleven.

original: de lta na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag spyi'i yul can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag spyi'i yul can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, the five sensory consciousnesses would have a generic image as their object, because they would have a generic image as their object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: They would not have a specific image as their object.

original: 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'dod kyi /
translated: We assert that the five sensory consciousnesses have as their object the specific characteristics of the sense bases.

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: They do not have as their object the specific characteristics of substances.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be investigated:

original: lus dang lce'i dbang po gnyis cig car du yul dang phrad na rnam par @31b shes pa gang sngar skye zhe na /
analyzed: lus dang lce'i dbang po gnyis cig car du yul dang phrad na rnam par @31b shes pa gang sngar skye zhe na /
translated: If the two sense faculties of the body and tongue simultaneously encounter their objects, which consciousness arises first?

original: gang gi yul shas che ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi yul shas che ba'o //
translated: The one that has the stronger object.

original: yul mnyam pa dang phrad na ni lce'i rnam par shes pa sngar skye ste /
analyzed: yul mnyam pa dang phrad na ni lce'i rnam par shes pa sngar skye ste /
translated: When the object is encountered equally, then the tongue consciousness arises first,

original: za bar 'dod pas rgyud gtad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za bar 'dod pas rgyud gtad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum is directed to eating.

original: dbang po lnga dang / don lnga dang / de dag la ji ltar 'dzin pa yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / don lnga dang / de dag la ji ltar 'dzin pa yang bshad zin to //
translated: The five sense faculties, the five objects, and how they are grasped have been explained.

original: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bsnyad par bya ba de brjod par bya ste /üîΩg-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
analyzed: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bsnyad par bya ba de brjod par bya ste / g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
translated: Now, non-informative matter should be explained.üîΩThat which is related to virtue and nonvirtue

original: dge dang mi dge'i rjes 'brel gang //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i rjes 'brel gang //
translated: of the distracted and mindless states,üîΩis said to be non-informative,

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //üîΩde ni rnam rig byed min brjod //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa // de ni rnam rig byed min brjod //
translated: taking the great elements as its cause.

original: sems g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i sems kyi yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i sems kyi yang yin pa'o //
translated: The distracted mind is that of a mind other than that.

original: sems med pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems med pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i yang yin pa'o //
translated: The mindless state is that of the mindless meditative attainments of non-perception and cessation.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also related to the undistracted mind.

original: dge dang mi dge zhes bya ba ni dge legs dang dge legs ma yin ba'o ;
analyzed: dge dang mi dge zhes bya ba ni dge legs dang dge legs ma yin ba'o ;
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are excellence and nonexcellence.

original: / rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni rgyun to //
analyzed: / rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni rgyun to //
translated: ‚ÄúContinuum‚Äù means a series.

original: thob pa'i rgyun yang 'di lta bu yod pas bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir /üîΩ'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyun yang 'di lta bu yod pas bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir / 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: Since there is a continuum of obtainment, in order to distinguish it,

original: zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: the root text says, ‚Äúthe great elements that are its cause.‚Äù

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the meaning of ‚Äúcause‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúthat which is made.‚Äù

original: skyed pa la sogs pa rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyed pa la sogs pa rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the nature of a cause is to generate and so on.

original: de ni rnam rig byed min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni rnam rig byed min zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called nonindicative.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i ming shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i ming shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúit‚Äù is used to indicate its name.

original: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan dag la rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan dag la rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: Although it has the nature of form and action, it is not indicative to others, as is indicative form.

original: brjed ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: brjed ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates the opinion of the teacher.

original: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: In brief, noninformative form is wholesome or unwholesome form derived from the elements of informative form and concentration.

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: Derived from the four great elements.

original: zhes smras pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four great elements?

original: 'byung ba dag ni sa'i khams dang ; chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni sa'i khams dang ; chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The four great elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.üîΩThey are called great elements because they are the cause of form that is derived and because they are the cause of form that is not derived.

original: bzhi po de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams dag go /'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gzugs gzhan thams cad kyi rten nyid du rigs pa'i phyir na chen po nyid do //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams dag go /'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gzugs gzhan thams cad kyi rten nyid du rigs pa'i phyir na chen po nyid do //
translated: The four great elements are called great because they are the support of all other forms.

original: @32a * // yang na sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi phung po de dag bya ba la shas che ba de dag la de rnams chen por gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @32a * // yang na sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi phung po de dag bya ba la shas che ba de dag la de rnams chen por gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, they are called great because the earth, water, fire, and wind that are the heaps of earth, water, fire, and wind are great in comparison to the other elements.

original: yang khams de dag gi las ni gang du yang dag par 'grub /
analyzed: yang khams de dag gi las ni gang du yang dag par 'grub /
translated: In what way are the great elements established?

original: rang bzhin ni ci zhe na /üîΩ'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ci zhe na / 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //
translated: What is their nature?

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: They are established as the functions of holding, etc.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa dang sdud pa dang smin par byed pa dang rgyas par byed pa'i las dag tu grub bo //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa dang sdud pa dang smin par byed pa dang rgyas par byed pa'i las dag tu grub bo //
translated: The elements of earth, water, fire, and wind are established as the functions of holding, gathering, ripening, and expanding, respectively.

original: rgyas par byed pa ni 'phel ba dang rgyas par byed par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa ni 'phel ba dang rgyas par byed par rig par bya ste /
translated: Expanding means increasing and growing.

original: 'di dag ni de dag gi las yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de dag gi las yin no //
translated: These are their functions.

original: rang bzhin ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: Their natures are, respectively,

original: sra gsher dro nyid g-yo ba rnams te /
analyzed: sra gsher dro nyid g-yo ba rnams te /
translated: hardness, liquidity, heat, and motion.

original: sra ba ni sa'i khams so //
analyzed: sra ba ni sa'i khams so //
translated: Hardness is the earth element.

original: gsher ba ni chu'i khams so //
analyzed: gsher ba ni chu'i khams so //
translated: Liquidity is the water element.

original: dro ba ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: dro ba ni me'i khams so //
translated: Heat is the fire element.

original: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams so //
translated: Motion is the wind element.

original: 'dis 'byung ba'i rgyun yul gzhan du skyed ba'i phyir g-yo bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dis 'byung ba'i rgyun yul gzhan du skyed ba'i phyir g-yo bar byed de /
translated: It is called motion because it generates the continuity of the elements in another place.

original: sgron ma g-yo ba bzhin du g-yo bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma g-yo ba bzhin du g-yo bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is called motion because it moves like a moving lamp.

original: rab tu byed pa dag dang mdo sde las rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag dang mdo sde las rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
translated: The Prakara·πáa and the s≈´tras state:üîΩWhat is the wind element?

original: yang ba nyid do zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: yang ba nyid do zhes gsungs la /
translated: The elements are mentioned in the Praj√±apti and in the S≈´tra: What is the wind element?üîΩLightness.

original: rab tu byed pa dag las /üîΩyang ba nyid de rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag las / yang ba nyid de rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: The Praj√±apti says:üîΩLightness is the primary matter derived from the four great elements.

original: de'i phyir g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos gang yin pa de ni rlung gi khams shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos gang yin pa de ni rlung gi khams shes pa ste /
translated: Thus the wind element is the dharma that has movement for its nature.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin las kyis gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin las kyis gsal ba yin no //
translated: Its nature is indicated by its activity.

original: sa la sogs pa dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between earth, etc., and the earth element, etc.?

original: 'jig rten gyi ni tha snyad do //üîΩkha dog dbyibs la sa zhes brjod //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni tha snyad do // kha dog dbyibs la sa zhes brjod //
translated: Earth, etc., are in common usage.üîΩEarth is color and shape.

original: 'di ltar sa ston pa na kha dog dang dbyibs ston par byed do ;üîΩ/ sa la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa ston pa na kha dog dang dbyibs ston par byed do ; / sa la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: When one points out earth, one points out color and shape.

original: chu me yang ngo //
analyzed: chu me yang ngo //
translated: The same for water and fire.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du kha dog dang dbyibs nyid la brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du kha dog dang dbyibs nyid la brjod do //
translated: Earth, etc., are in common usage.

original: rlung tshogs khams nyid yin /
analyzed: rlung tshogs khams nyid yin /
translated: Wind is in common usage.üîΩThe wind element is in common usage.

original: rlung gi khams gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten na rlung zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten na rlung zhes 'dogs so //
translated: The element of wind is what is called wind in the world.

original: de dang 'dra ba'ang yin /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'ang yin /
translated: It is also similar to that.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du kha dog dang dbyibs la sa zhes brjod pa de bzhin du rlung la yang rlung sngon po rlung zlum po'o zhes brjod do //
