analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du kha dog dang dbyibs la sa zhes brjod pa de bzhin du rlung la yang rlung sngon po rlung zlum po'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Just as the color and shape of the earth are called earth in conventional usage, so wind is also called blue wind or round wind.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin ba'i par 'di gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin ba'i par 'di gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is this called the aggregate of material form up to and including non-informative form?

original: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is suitable as form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs su yod cing @32b gzugs su rung bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs su yod cing @32b gzugs su rung bas /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúMonks, it exists as form and is suitable as form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the aggregate of grasping material form.

original: cis gzugs su rung zhe na /
analyzed: cis gzugs su rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it suitable as form?

original: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pas na reg na yang gzugs su rung ngo zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pas na reg na yang gzugs su rung ngo zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is form that is suitable to be touched by contact with the hand. It is said to be form in detail.

original: gzugs su rung zhes bya ba ni gnod par byar rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste 'di ltar don gyi sde tshan dag las /
analyzed: gzugs su rung zhes bya ba ni gnod par byar rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste 'di ltar don gyi sde tshan dag las /
translated: The term ‚Äúcapable of materialization‚Äù means ‚Äúcapable of being harmed,‚Äù as is stated in the following verse from the Dhatukaya:

original: gal te 'dod pa tshol byed cing //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa tshol byed cing //
translated: If one seeks for the desired object,

original: 'dun pa skyes pa'i lus can te /
analyzed: 'dun pa skyes pa'i lus can te /
translated: and the body is born with desire,

original: 'dod pa de dag ma 'byor na //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag ma 'byor na //
translated: if one does not obtain the desired object,

original: zug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: one is harmed as if by a dart.

original: gzugs kyi gnod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the harm in materiality?

original: yongs su 'gyur ba skyed pa'o ;
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba skyed pa'o ;
translated: It is the production of transformation.

original: / gzhan dag na re gzugs su rung ba ni thogs pa'o zhes zer ro //üîΩ'o na ni rdul phra rab gzugs ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re gzugs su rung ba ni thogs pa'o zhes zer ro // 'o na ni rdul phra rab gzugs ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Others say: ‚ÄúCapable of materialization‚Äù means ‚Äúcapable of obstruction.‚Äù

original: gzugs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in that case, the subtle atom would not be material, because it is not capable of materialization.

original: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig pu logs shig tu gyur pa ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig pu logs shig tu gyur pa ni med pa nyid do //
translated: But the subtle atom does not exist separately by itself.

original: 'dus pa la gnas pa de la ni gzugs su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus pa la gnas pa de la ni gzugs su rung ba nyid do //
translated: It is only in the aggregate that it is capable of materialization.

original: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, the past and future would not be material.

original: de yang gzugs su yod zin pa dang / gzugs su yod par 'gyur ba dang / de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs yin te bud shing bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs su yod zin pa dang / gzugs su yod par 'gyur ba dang / de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs yin te bud shing bzhin no //
translated: It is form because it is the basis of the form that has already arisen, the form that will arise, and the form that is of the same type, like fuel.

original: 'o na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But unmanifested form would not be form.

original: de yang rnam par rig byed la gzugs su lod pa'i phyir gzugs su yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rig byed la gzugs su lod pa'i phyir gzugs su yod par 'gyur te /
translated: It is form because it is the basis of manifested form.

original: shing ljon pa g-yos bas grib ma g-yo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing ljon pa g-yos bas grib ma g-yo ba bzhin no //
translated: Like the movement of the shade caused by a tree.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: It is not because it is unchangeable.

original: rnam par rig byed log na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed log na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: For if manifested form ceases, unmanifested form would also cease.

original: shing ljon pa med na grib ma med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing ljon pa med na grib ma med pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the shade when the tree moves or falls.

original: gzhan dag na re rten gyi 'byung ba la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rten gyi 'byung ba la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is form because the primary elements that are its basis are form.

original: de lta na 'o na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang rten gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang rten gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then eye consciousness and so on would become form because the form that is their basis is form.

original: nye bar bkod pa 'di ni mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa 'di ni mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: This example is not appropriate.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin ba 'di ni shing ljon pa la grib ma nyid dang / nor bu la 'od nyid bzhin du 'byung ba rnams la brten nas 'jug go //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes ba la sogs pa ni de ltar mig la sogs pa la brten nas 'jug @33a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin ba 'di ni shing ljon pa la grib ma nyid dang / nor bu la 'od nyid bzhin du 'byung ba rnams la brten nas 'jug go // mig gi rnam par shes ba la sogs pa ni de ltar mig la sogs pa la brten nas 'jug @33a * //
translated: Nonindicative form occurs in dependence on the primary elements, like the shade and light of a tree and a jewel.

original: pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ma yin te /
translated: Eye consciousness and so on do not occur in dependence on the eyes and so forth,

original: de dag ni de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam yin pa 'ba' zhig tsam du zad pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam yin pa 'ba' zhig tsam du zad pas so //
translated: because they are merely the causal condition of their arising.

original: shing ljon pa la brten nas grib ma dang / mar me la brten nas 'od 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig bye brag tu smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa la brten nas grib ma dang / mar me la brten nas 'od 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig bye brag tu smra ba ma yin te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas do not say that shade occurs in dependence on a tree and light occurs in dependence on a jewel,

original: grib ma la sogs pa kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams so so rang gi 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grib ma la sogs pa kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams so so rang gi 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they accept that the subtle particles of color and so on that constitute shade and so forth occur in dependence on their own set of four primary elements.

original: grib ma dang 'od de dag la brten pa nyid yin yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rten 'byung ba chen po dag 'gags kyang 'gag par khas len pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni de ltar brten par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: grib ma dang 'od de dag la brten pa nyid yin yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rten 'byung ba chen po dag 'gags kyang 'gag par khas len pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni de ltar brten par mi rung ngo //
translated: Although shadows and light are supported by them, you accept that when the great elements that are the support of non-informative action cease, the non-informative action ceases.

original: de'i phyir de ni lan du mi rung ngo //üîΩgzhan dag ni 'di la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten ni tha dad du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni lan du mi rung ngo // gzhan dag ni 'di la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten ni tha dad du gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, your response is not appropriate.üîΩOthers say: The support of eye consciousness, etc., is different.

original: kha cig ni gzugs su rung ba ste mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs su rung ba ste mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some are capable of materiality, such as the eye faculty, etc.

original: la la ni gzugs su mi rung ba ste yid do //
analyzed: la la ni gzugs su mi rung ba ste yid do //
translated: Some are not capable of materiality, such as the mental faculty.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Non-informative action is not like that.

original: de lta bas na 'dra bar thal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dra bar thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the error of similarity does not arise.

original: de'i phyir gzugs su yod pas na gzugs so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad pa yin no zhes lan 'debs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs su yod pas na gzugs so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad pa yin no zhes lan 'debs so //
translated: Therefore, this is correct: ‚ÄúIt is form because it exists as materiality.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: The nature of the form aggregate is taught.

original: dbang don de dag kho na la //üîΩskye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
analyzed: dbang don de dag kho na la // skye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
translated: The sense-spheres and elements are established in the same way.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni skye mched bcu ste /
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni skye mched bcu ste /
translated: The sense-spheres are established as ten sense-spheres,

original: mig gi skye mched dang gzugs kyi skye mched nas /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang gzugs kyi skye mched nas /
translated: from the eye sense-sphere and form sense-sphere up to

original: lus kyi skye mched dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar yin no //
translated: the body sense-sphere and tangible object sense-sphere.

original: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni de dag nyid khams bcu ste /
analyzed: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni de dag nyid khams bcu ste /
translated: The elements are established as ten elements,

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams nas /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams nas /
translated: from the eye element and form element up to

original: lus kyi khams dang reg bya'i khams kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi khams dang reg bya'i khams kyi bar yin no //
translated: the body element and tangible object element.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / de'i skye mched dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / de'i skye mched dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of form and its sense-sphere and element have been explained.

original: tshor ba la logs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la logs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now feeling should be discussed.

original: de la tshor ba myong ba /
analyzed: de la tshor ba myong ba /
translated: Feeling is the experience of that.

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is the experience of the three kinds of experience:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de yang dbye na tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: de yang dbye na tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: When classified, there are six collections of feeling.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas /üîΩyid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i @33b bar ro ;
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i @33b bar ro ;
translated: Feeling arising from the contact of eye and form is the first.

original: /'du shes ni /
analyzed: /'du shes ni /
translated: Feeling arising from the contact of mind and mental objects is the sixth.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Discrimination is the nature of apprehending signs.

original: gang sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / pho dang / mo dang / mdza' bshes dang / mdza' bshes ma yin pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par la mtshan mar 'dzin ba de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gang sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / pho dang / mo dang / mdza' bshes dang / mdza' bshes ma yin pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par la mtshan mar 'dzin ba de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The nature of apprehending signs of the differences of things such as blue and yellow, long and short, male and female, friend and foe, pleasure and pain is the aggregate of discrimination.

original: de yang dbye na 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: de yang dbye na 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
translated: When classified, there are six collections of discrimination,

original: tshor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba bzhin no //
translated: like the six collections of feeling.

original: 'du byed phung po bzhi las gzhan //
analyzed: 'du byed phung po bzhi las gzhan //
translated: The aggregate of formation is other than the four aggregates.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang phung po bzhi las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o ;
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang phung po bzhi las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o ;
translated: The aggregate of formation is the formations other than the four aggregates of form, feeling, discrimination and consciousness.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las /üîΩsems pa tshogs drug go zhes gsungs pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las / sems pa tshogs drug go zhes gsungs pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the sutra:üîΩThe six collections of volition.üîΩThis is the chief because it is the nature of action.

original: de ni las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'du bya ba la gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'du bya ba la gtso bo yin no //
translated: It is the chief in the performance of the formative forces.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason the Bhagavat has said:

original: 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed de ;
analyzed: 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed de ;
translated: The conditioned is the formative forces.

original: de lta bas na 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are called the appropriating aggregates.

original: de lta ma yin na sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams dang ldan ba ma yin pa rnams phung por 'dus pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas yongs su shes pa dang spang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams dang ldan ba ma yin pa rnams phung por 'dus pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas yongs su shes pa dang spang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the remaining mental factors and the dissociated forces would not be included in the aggregates, and would not be the truth of suffering or the truth of origination.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni /
translated: The Bhagavat has said:

original: chos gcig mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes par yang sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: chos gcig mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes par yang sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: I do not say that one can reach the end of suffering without fully understanding and knowing one factor.

original: de bzhin du ma spangs par yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma spangs par yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: So too, they are not abandoned.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar de dag 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar de dag 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that they are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: de gsum / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dag ste /
analyzed: de gsum / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dag ste /
translated: These three are the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formations.

original: skye mched dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The presentation of the bases and elementsüîΩis as follows:

original: rnam rig byed min dang / 'dus ma byas rnams bcas pa ni //
analyzed: rnam rig byed min dang / 'dus ma byas rnams bcas pa ni //
translated: The nonindicative, the unconditioned,

original: chos kyi skye mched khams zhes bya ;
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched khams zhes bya ;
translated: are called the phenomena base and element.

original: / de ltar na rdzas bdun po de dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar na rdzas bdun po de dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, these seven substances are called the phenomena base and the phenomena element.

original: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
analyzed: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
translated: Consciousness is the awareness of each object.

original: yul dang yul la so sor rnam par rig cing dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //üîΩde yang rnam par shes pa'i @34a * //
analyzed: yul dang yul la so sor rnam par rig cing dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o // de yang rnam par shes pa'i @34a * //
translated: The awareness of each object and the observation of each object is called the aggregate of consciousness.

original: tshogs drug ste /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: tshogs drug ste / mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: That is also the six collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
translated: They are the eye consciousness up to the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po bstan pa gang yin pa de skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po bstan pa gang yin pa de skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the mental sense base and the seven elements of consciousness.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin /üîΩkhams rnam par gzhag pa yang de dag nyid /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin / khams rnam par gzhag pa yang de dag nyid /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: khams bdun dag tu'ang 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: khams bdun dag tu'ang 'dod pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the seven elements of consciousness.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: rnam par shes pa drug dang yid //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug dang yid //
translated: The six classes of consciousness and the mind.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams kyi bar ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams kyi bar ro //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the six classes of consciousness, from eye consciousness to mind consciousness, and the mind element.

original: de ltar na 'dir phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in this system, there are five aggregates, twelve sense bases, and eighteen elements.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi phung po'i skye mched bcu dang / khams bcu dag go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi phung po'i skye mched bcu dang / khams bcu dag go //
translated: The ten sense bases and ten elements of form, excluding nonindicative form, are the aggregate of form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: The three aggregates of feeling and so on, nonindicative form and unconditioned phenomena are the phenomena element and phenomena sense base.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi khams so //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the sense-sphere of the mental faculty, the six elements of consciousness, and the element of the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt the six collections of consciousness explained as the aggregate of consciousness?

original: yang de dag las gzhan pa yid kyi khams de gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag las gzhan pa yid kyi khams de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that other mental faculty apart from them?

original: gzhan ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing other than them.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩdrug po de dag / nyid las 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / drug po de dag / nyid las 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: What then?

original: rnam shes gang yin de yod do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yod do //
translated: The mental faculty is the immediately past consciousness of those six.

original: rnam par shes pa gang dang gang 'gags ma thag pa de nyid ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang dang gang 'gags ma thag pa de nyid ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the immediately past consciousness of those six is the mental faculty.

original: dper na bu de nyid gzhan gyi phar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu de nyid gzhan gyi phar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, that very son becomes the father of another, and that very fruit is the seed of another.

original: de lta na 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drag dang yid kyi khams rnams gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas su na khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su 'gyur na ci'i phyir khams bco brgyad du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drag dang yid kyi khams rnams gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas su na khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su 'gyur na ci'i phyir khams bco brgyad du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If that is so, then since the six elements of consciousness and the mind element are included in each other, there would be seventeen or twelve substances. Why are they posited as eighteen elements?

original: de lta'ang yin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang / drug pa'i rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: de lta'ang yin mod kyi / 'on kyang / drug pa'i rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: That is so, butüîΩthe eighteen elements are asserted

original: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
translated: in order to establish the support of the sixth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag gi rten lnga ni mig gi khams la sogs pa yin na drug po yid kyi rnam @34b par shes pa'i khams kyi rten ni gzhan med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag gi rten lnga ni mig gi khams la sogs pa yin na drug po yid kyi rnam @34b par shes pa'i khams kyi rten ni gzhan med de /
translated: The five sense organs such as the eyes are the supports of the five consciousnesses such as eye consciousness. The sixth mental consciousness has no other support.

original: de'i phyir de'i rten rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yid kyi khams bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rten rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yid kyi khams bstan to //
translated: Therefore the mind element is taught in order to establish its support.

original: de ltar na rten pa dang dmigs pa drug tshan rnam par gzhag pas khams bco brgyad dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rten pa dang dmigs pa drug tshan rnam par gzhag pas khams bco brgyad dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the eighteen elements are posited by way of the two sets of six: the six supports and the six focal objects.

original: 'o na ni dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma yid ma yin par 'gyur ta /
analyzed: 'o na ni dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma yid ma yin par 'gyur ta /
translated: But then the final thought of an arhat would not be the mental faculty.

original: de gang gis mtshungs pa de ma thag pa 'das par 'gyur ba de ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gis mtshungs pa de ma thag pa 'das par 'gyur ba de ni med do zhe na /
translated: And that which is similar to it would not be the immediately past mental faculty.

original: de yang yid kyi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir na ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yid kyi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir na ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so, because it exists in the nature of the mental faculty.

original: rgyu gzhan mtshang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye bar zad do //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan mtshang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye bar zad do //
translated: The reason is that a subsequent consciousness does not arise due to the absence of another cause.

original: de la phung po dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so ;
analyzed: de la phung po dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so ;
translated: All conditioned states are included in the aggregates.

original: / nye bar len pa'i phung po de dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: / nye bar len pa'i phung po de dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad bsdus so //
translated: All contaminated states are included in the appropriated aggregates.

original: skye mched dang khams dag gis ni chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: skye mched dang khams dag gis ni chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: All phenomena are included in the bases and elements.

original: mdor bsdu na phung po dang ni skye mched dang / khams gcig gis ni thams cad bsdus par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na phung po dang ni skye mched dang / khams gcig gis ni thams cad bsdus par shes par bya ste /
translated: In brief, all are included in one aggregate, one base, and one element.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams kyis chos rnams thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams kyis chos rnams thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: All phenomena are included in the form aggregate, the mental faculty base, and the phenomena element.

original: bsdu ba de ni gang dang gang nas 'byung yang rung /üîΩrang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: bsdu ba de ni gang dang gang nas 'byung yang rung / rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: Whatever the case, the inclusion should be understood as being by way of own nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos pos ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos pos ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: not by way of other nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyi dngos dang mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos dang mi ldan phyir //
translated: Because it is not endowed with other natures.

original: chos ni gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: chos ni gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan no //
translated: A phenomenon is not endowed with other natures.

original: de lta bas na gang dang mi ldan bde nyid kyis bsdus par ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dang mi ldan bde nyid kyis bsdus par ni mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable that it is included by that with which it is not endowed.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / mig gi skye mched dang / khams dag dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / mig gi skye mched dang / khams dag dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag gis bsdus te /
translated: For example, the eye faculty is included in the form aggregate, the eye source and element, and the truths of suffering and origin

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is their nature.

original: de dag gi ngo bo dang mi ldan pa'i phyir phung po la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo dang mi ldan pa'i phyir phung po la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not included by other aggregates and so on because it is not endowed with their nature.

original: dper na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis 'khor rnams bsdus pa lta bu gzhan gyis gzhan bsdus so zhes bya ba gang yin ba de ni res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir brdar btags pa yin par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis 'khor rnams bsdus pa lta bu gzhan gyis gzhan bsdus so zhes bya ba gang yin ba de ni res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir brdar btags pa yin par bya'o //
translated: For example, the four means of gathering disciples gather a retinue.

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna dag gnyis gnyis yod pa'i phyir khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna dag gnyis gnyis yod pa'i phyir khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the eye and ear and nose each have two parts, shouldn‚Äôt there be twenty-one elements?üîΩThere shouldn‚Äôt be, because:

original: 'di ltar / mig la sogs pa gnyis mod kyi //üîΩrigs dang spyod yul @35a * //üîΩrnam par shes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mig la sogs pa gnyis mod kyi // rigs dang spyod yul @35a * // rnam par shes //
translated: Although there are two eyes, etc.,üîΩthey are one element,üîΩbecause of similarity of type,

original: 'dra ba'i phyir na khams gcig nyid //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir na khams gcig nyid //
translated: object, and consciousness.

original: de la rigs 'dra ba ni gnyi ga mig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rigs 'dra ba ni gnyi ga mig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúsimilarity of type‚Äù means that both are by nature eye.

original: spyod yul 'dra ba ni gnyi ga'i yul gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod yul 'dra ba ni gnyi ga'i yul gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSimilarity of object‚Äù means that the object of both is form.

original: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyi ga mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyi ga mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúSimilarity of consciousness‚Äù means that both are the basis of a single eye consciousness.

original: de lta bas na mig gi khams ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig gi khams ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the eye element is only one.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the ear and nose.

original: mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: Two exist for the sake of beauty.

original: mig la sogs pa khams gcig pa nyid yin yang rten mdzes par bya ba'i phyir gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa khams gcig pa nyid yin yang rten mdzes par bya ba'i phyir gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though the eye element, etc. are one in substance, two arise for the sake of the beauty of the support.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise,

original: mig dang rna ba'i rten gcig dang // sna'i bu ga gcig tu gyur na shin tu mi mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i rten gcig dang // sna'i bu ga gcig tu gyur na shin tu mi mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: if the support of the eye and ear were one and the nostril were one, it would be very ugly.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and bases have been explained.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi don gang yin pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /üîΩspungs dang skye dgu rigs kyi don //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi don gang yin pa 'dir brjod par bya ste / spungs dang skye dgu rigs kyi don //
translated: Now, the meaning of the aggregates, elements, and bases should be stated here.üîΩThe meaning of aggregate is a heap,üîΩthe meaning of element is family,

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
translated: and the meaning of base is origin.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las / gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: mdo las / gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung 'das pa 'am /
translated: Any form whatsoever, whether past,

original: ma 'ongs pa 'am /üîΩda ltar byung ba 'am /üîΩnang gi 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'am / da ltar byung ba 'am / nang gi 'am /
translated: present, or future,

original: phyi'i 'am / rags pa 'am /üîΩphra ba'am / ngan pa 'am /
analyzed: phyi'i 'am / rags pa 'am / phra ba'am / ngan pa 'am /
translated: internal or external,üîΩcoarse or subtle,

original: gya nom pa 'am /
analyzed: gya nom pa 'am /
translated: inferior or excellent,üîΩfar or near.

original: thag ring ba na yod pa gang yin ba 'am /
analyzed: thag ring ba na yod pa gang yin ba 'am /
translated: Whatever exists far away or near,üîΩall of that is included in the aggregate of form.

original: nye ba na yod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: nye ba na yod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Thus, the meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is established as the meaning of ‚Äúheap.‚Äù

original: de la bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gzugs 'das pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: de la bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gzugs 'das pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gags pa'o //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: Past form is that which has ceased due to impermanence.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'o //
translated: Future form is that which has not yet arisen.

original: da ltar byung ba la ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Present form is that which has arisen but not yet ceased.

original: nang gi ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'o //
translated: Internal form is that which exists in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: gzhan ni phyi'i 'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni phyi'i 'o //
translated: External form is that which exists in the continuum of another.

original: yang skye mched kyi sgo nas so //üîΩrags pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang skye mched kyi sgo nas so // rags pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Or, from the perspective of the sense bases,üîΩgross form is that which is impeded.

original: phra ba ni thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Subtle form is that which is unimpeded.

original: yang na ltos pa pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na ltos pa pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is relative.

original: gal te ltos pa pa yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa pa yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not established because it is relative,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different in dependence.

original: gang la ltos te rags pa yin pa ni nam du yang de la ltos nas phra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la ltos te rags pa yin pa ni nam du yang de la ltos nas phra ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is gross in relation to something is never subtle in relation to it.

original: pha dang bu bzhin no //
analyzed: pha dang bu bzhin no //
translated: It is like a father and son.

original: ngan pa ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: ngan pa ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Bad means afflicted.

original: gya nom pa ni @35b nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa ni @35b nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Good means unafflicted.

original: ring ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ring ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: Far means past and future.

original: nye ba ni da ltar byung ba ste /
analyzed: nye ba ni da ltar byung ba ste /
translated: Near means present.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true up to consciousness.

original: 'di ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par yin te /
translated: This is the difference.

original: rags pa ni dbang po lnga la brtan pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa ni dbang po lnga la brtan pa'o //
translated: The gross is based on the five faculties.

original: phra ba ni yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni yid las byung ba'o //
translated: The subtle is mental.

original: yang na sa las rig par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: yang na sa las rig par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Or it should be understood from the levels.

original: btsun pa na re ni gzugs rags pa ni dbang po lngas gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: btsun pa na re ni gzugs rags pa ni dbang po lngas gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The Bhadanta says: The gross form is that which is apprehended by the five faculties.

original: gzhan ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni phra ba'o //
translated: The other is subtle.

original: ngan pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Bad means unpleasant.

original: gya nom pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //üîΩring ba ni yul mi snang ba can no //
analyzed: gya nom pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o // ring ba ni yul mi snang ba can no //
translated: Good means pleasant.üîΩFar means having an invisible object.

original: nye ba ni yul snang ba can no //
analyzed: nye ba ni yul snang ba can no //
translated: Near means having a visible object.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa ni rang gi ming gis bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa ni rang gi ming gis bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The past, etc., are indicated by their own names.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Feeling, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: de dag gis ring ba dang nye ba nyid ni de rten gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de dag gis ring ba dang nye ba nyid ni de rten gyi dbang gis so //
translated: Their remoteness and proximity is due to the power of their basis.

original: rags pa dang phra ba nyid ni snga ma bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba nyid ni snga ma bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Their grossness and subtlety is as before.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don te ;
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don te ;
translated: The meaning of sense base is the door for the arising of mind and mental factors.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba mched par byed bas skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba mched par byed bas skye mched rnams te /
translated: Etymologically, they are sense bases because they extend the arising of mind and mental factors.

original: rgyas par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go / rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don te /
analyzed: rgyas par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go / rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don te /
translated: They extend means they increase. The meaning of element is the meaning of lineage.

original: dper na ri 'ga' zhig la lcags dang zangs dang dngul dang gser la sogs pa rigs mang po dag yod pa la khams zhes brjod pa de bzhin du rten dang rgyud gcig la rigs bco brgyad dag yod pa la khams bco brgyad ces bya'o //üîΩde la 'byung gnas dag ni rigs zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa 'di dag gang gi 'byung gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ri 'ga' zhig la lcags dang zangs dang dngul dang gser la sogs pa rigs mang po dag yod pa la khams zhes brjod pa de bzhin du rten dang rgyud gcig la rigs bco brgyad dag yod pa la khams bco brgyad ces bya'o // de la 'byung gnas dag ni rigs zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa 'di dag gang gi 'byung gnas yin zhe na /
translated: Just as a mountain is said to have many kinds of minerals, iron, copper, silver, gold, etc., in the same way, the eighteen elements are said to be the eighteen kinds of dhƒÅtu, of natures, in the single stream of the aggregates.üîΩWhat is the meaning of dhƒÅtu?

original: rang gi rigs kyi yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi yin te /
translated: The meaning of dhƒÅtu is origin, because the eye, etc., are the origins of their own families.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the homogeneous causes of each other.

original: 'dus ma byas khams ma yin bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩ'o na ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas khams ma yin bar 'gyur ro zhe na / 'o na ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yin no //
translated: If the unconditioned is not a dhƒÅtu, then the eighteen dhƒÅtus are not elements.üîΩThe unconditioned is not a dhƒÅtu because it is not a cause.

original: gzhan dag na re chos bco brgyad po dag rigs kyi rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos bco brgyad po dag rigs kyi rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: But if the unconditioned is not a dhƒÅtu, then the eighteen dhƒÅtus are not elements.

original: khams bco brgyad ces bya bas khams zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rigs kyi tshig yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ces bya bas khams zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rigs kyi tshig yin zhes zer ro //
translated: The eighteen dhƒÅtus are the eighteen kinds of dhƒÅtu, because the word dhƒÅtu is a word for kind.

original: gal te spungs pa'i don phung po'i don yin na phung po rnams btags pa'i yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te spungs pa'i don phung po'i don yin na phung po rnams btags pa'i yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúheap‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúaggregate,‚Äù the aggregates would be imputedly existent because they are a collection of substances.

original: rdzas sum 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir spungs pa dang gang zag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas sum 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir spungs pa dang gang zag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: This is like a heap and a person.

original: ma yin te /üîΩrdzas kyi rdul phra rab gcig pu yang @36a * //
analyzed: ma yin te / rdzas kyi rdul phra rab gcig pu yang @36a * //
translated: That is not so,

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a single substantial minute particle is an aggregate.

original: de lta na gcig pu la spungs pa nyid med pas spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes brjod par mi bya'o //üîΩgzhan dag na re /üîΩbya ba'i khur khyer ba'i don nam /
analyzed: de lta na gcig pu la spungs pa nyid med pas spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes brjod par mi bya'o // gzhan dag na re / bya ba'i khur khyer ba'i don nam /
translated: Thus, since a single thing is not a heap, you should not say that the meaning of ‚Äúheap‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúaggregate.‚Äù

original: yongs su chad pa'i don ni phung po'i don te /
analyzed: yongs su chad pa'i don ni phung po'i don te /
translated: Others say: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúbearing a load of action‚Äù or the meaning of ‚Äúbeing cut off.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar smra ba po dbul bar bya ba'i phung po gsum dag tu dbul bar bya'o zhes smra ba bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba po dbul bar bya ba'i phung po gsum dag tu dbul bar bya'o zhes smra ba bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: Thus, it is like saying, ‚ÄúOfferings should be made to the three heaps of things to be offered.‚Äù

original: de ni mdo dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni mdo dang 'gal lo //
translated: That contradicts the sutras.

original: mdo las ni spungs pa'i don kho nar gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las ni spungs pa'i don kho nar gsungs te /
translated: The sutras state that the meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúheap.‚Äù

original: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa'am /
translated: Any form at all, whether past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'am zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: and so on at length.

original: der ni gzugs 'das pa la sogs pa so sor phung po nyid yin par shes te /
analyzed: der ni gzugs 'das pa la sogs pa so sor phung po nyid yin par shes te /
translated: Here, it is understood that past form, etc., are individually aggregates.

original: gzugs 'das pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad re re zhing gzugs kyi phung po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad re re zhing gzugs kyi phung po yin no zhe na /
translated: All of these past forms, etc., are individually the form aggregate.

original: de ltar ni shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar ni shes par mi nus te /
translated: This is not understood,

original: de thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, ‚Äúhaving combined all of them together.

original: de lta bas na gzugs kyi phung po dag ni spungs pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs kyi phung po dag ni spungs pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù Therefore, like a heap, the form aggregates exist as designations.

original: de lta na skye mched gzugs can rnams kyang btags pa'i yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na skye mched gzugs can rnams kyang btags pa'i yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the physical bases would also be designated as existing,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab mang po ni skye ba'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te tshogs pa rnams re re nas rgyu'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab mang po ni skye ba'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na / ma yin te tshogs pa rnams re re nas rgyu'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because many atoms of the eye, etc., are the door for the arising of consciousness.

original: yul lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po las logs shig tu skye mched du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po las logs shig tu skye mched du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: No, because the collection is the cause individually, or because the object is a cooperating condition, the physical bases would not be separate from the sense faculties.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni /
translated: The great commentary explains:

original: gal te chos mngon pa ba zhig phung po btags pa'i yod par lta na ni de rdul phra rab khams gcig dang / skye mched gcig dang / phung po gcig gi phyogs yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gal te chos mngon pa ba zhig phung po btags pa'i yod par lta na ni de rdul phra rab khams gcig dang / skye mched gcig dang / phung po gcig gi phyogs yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: If an Abhidharma master views the aggregates as imputedly existent, he would say that a subtle particle is one part of one element, one base, and one aggregate.

original: 'on te mi lta na ni de rdul phra rab khams gcig dang / skye mched gcig dang / phung po gcig yin no zhes smra'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te mi lta na ni de rdul phra rab khams gcig dang / skye mched gcig dang / phung po gcig yin no zhes smra'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If he does not view them as imputedly existent, he would say that a subtle particle is one element, one base, and one aggregate.

original: phyogs yin yang phyogs can yin bzhin du nye bar 'dogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: phyogs yin yang phyogs can yin bzhin du nye bar 'dogs pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also designation of a part as a whole,

original: dper na ras yug gi phyogs gcig tshig pa la ras yug tshig gi zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ras yug gi phyogs gcig tshig pa la ras yug tshig gi zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: as when one says a cloth is burned when one part of the cloth is burned.üîΩWhy did the Bhagavan compose the three teachings of the aggregates and so on?

original: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa rnam pa gsum rtsom par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa rnam pa gsum rtsom par mdzad ce na /
translated: He did so for the sake of disciples

original: smras pa / gdul ba rnams kyi //
analyzed: smras pa / gdul ba rnams kyi //
translated: who are confused,

original: rmongs dbang 'dod rnams gsum gyi phyir //
analyzed: rmongs dbang 'dod rnams gsum gyi phyir //
translated: who have desire, and who have the three.

original: @36b phung po la sogs gsum bstan to //üîΩrnam pa gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: @36b phung po la sogs gsum bstan to // rnam pa gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
translated: The three are the aggregates, etc.

original: sems can rnams kyi rmongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rmongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three aspects are the three kinds of delusion of beings.

original: kha cig ni sems las byung ba rnams la ril po'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas rmongs so //
analyzed: kha cig ni sems las byung ba rnams la ril po'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas rmongs so //
translated: Some are deluded because they grasp the mental factors as a unified self.

original: kha cig ni gzugs kho na la'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs kho na la'o //
translated: Some are deluded only about form.

original: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems dag la'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems dag la'o //
translated: Some are deluded about both form and mind.

original: dbang po dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The faculties are also of three kinds:

original: dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po'i phyir ro //
translated: sharp, middling, and dull.

original: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The inclinations are also of three kinds:

original: tshig bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgya chen po 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgya chen po 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: those who prefer the brief, the middling, and the extensive.

original: de dag la go rims bzhin du phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang gsum bstan to zhes grag go / yang ci'i phyir sems las byung ba gzhan rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po gcig tu bsdus la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni logs shig tu phung por byas she na /
analyzed: de dag la go rims bzhin du phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang gsum bstan to zhes grag go / yang ci'i phyir sems las byung ba gzhan rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po gcig tu bsdus la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni logs shig tu phung por byas she na /
translated: Why are the other mental factors included in the aggregate of formation, but feeling and conception are made into separate aggregates?üîΩThey are the roots of dispute,

original: smras pa / rtsod pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa dang // 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir rim rgyu'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / rtsod pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa dang // 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir rim rgyu'i phyir //
translated: the cause of cyclic existence, and the order of development.üîΩFrom among the mental factors, feeling and conception are made into separate aggregates because they are the roots of dispute, the cause of cyclic existence, and the order of their development.

original: sems byung rnams las tshor ba dang // 'du shes logs shig phung por bzhag / rtsod pa'i rtsa bdag ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sems byung rnams las tshor ba dang // 'du shes logs shig phung por bzhag / rtsod pa'i rtsa bdag ni gnyis te /
translated: The roots of dispute are two:

original: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / lta ba la lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / lta ba la lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: attachment to sense objects and attachment to views.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ste /
translated: The primary causes of those two are, respectively, feeling and conception.

original: tshor ba ro myang ba'i dbang gis ni 'dod pa rnams las mngon par zhen la /
analyzed: tshor ba ro myang ba'i dbang gis ni 'dod pa rnams las mngon par zhen la /
translated: One becomes attached to sense objects through the power of experiencing feelings.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log gis ni lta ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gis ni lta ba rnams la'o //
translated: The views are due to a distorted ideation.

original: de dag ni 'khor pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yang yin te /
translated: These two are the principal causes of cyclic existence.

original: tshor ba la zhen cing 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen cing 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni 'khor ro //
translated: One transmigrates due to attachment to sensation and due to a distorted ideation.

original: gang yang phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu ston par 'gyur ba'i go rims kyi rgyu de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis logs shig tu phung por byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu ston par 'gyur ba'i go rims kyi rgyu de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis logs shig tu phung por byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should also understand that these two are distinguished as separate aggregates because they are the causes of the order of the aggregates, a cause that will be explained.

original: de ni de nyid du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de nyid du bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in the section on the order of the aggregates.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched dang khams dag tu ni 'dus ma byas bshad la /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched dang khams dag tu ni 'dus ma byas bshad la /
translated: Why is unconditioned included among the sense bases and elements,

original: phung po dag tu ni ma yin zhe na /üîΩphung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: phung po dag tu ni ma yin zhe na / phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
translated: but not among the aggregates?üîΩUnconditioned is not mentioned as an aggregate

original: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad//
analyzed: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad//
translated: because it is not included in the meaning of aggregate.

original: de ni phung po dag gi nang du brjod na de ni gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas don du mi rung ba'i phyir re zhig de dag nyid kyi nang du bsdu bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni phung po dag gi nang du brjod na de ni gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas don du mi rung ba'i phyir re zhig de dag nyid kyi nang du bsdu bar ni mi nus so //
translated: If it is said to be included among the aggregates, it is not form, up to and including consciousness, so it is not suitable as an object. Therefore, it cannot be included among those aggregates.

original: phung po drug par brjod par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: phung po drug par brjod par yang mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be said to be a sixth aggregate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: don du mi rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩspungs pa'i @37a * //
analyzed: don du mi rung ba'i phyir te / spungs pa'i @37a * //
translated: Because it is not suitable as an object.

original: don du ni phung po'i don to zhes bshad na /
analyzed: don du ni phung po'i don to zhes bshad na /
translated: The meaning of aggregate is the meaning of heap.

original: 'dus ma byas na gzugs bzhin du 'di ltar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas 'dus ma byas kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas na gzugs bzhin du 'di ltar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas 'dus ma byas kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: But unconditioned states are not different, like form, by way of distinctions of past, future, and so on, such that they can be combined into one and called the unconditioned aggregate.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya la /
translated: Moreover, the term appropriated aggregates is used to indicate the basis of affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir phung po zhes kyang bya na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir phung po zhes kyang bya na /
translated: The aggregates are so called because they are the basis of the afflicted and the purified.

original: 'dus ma byas ni don du mi rung ba'i phyir gnyi ga yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni don du mi rung ba'i phyir gnyi ga yang ma yin te /
translated: But the unconditioned does not serve as a basis in either way, because it is not possible for it to be either afflicted or purified.

original: de dag tu rnam par gzhag go / kha cig na re ji ltar bum pa chag pa bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po zhig pa yang phung po yin par mi 'os so zhes zer te /
analyzed: de dag tu rnam par gzhag go / kha cig na re ji ltar bum pa chag pa bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po zhig pa yang phung po yin par mi 'os so zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: Just as a broken pot is not a pot, so too a destroyed aggregate is not an aggregate.

original: de dag gi ltar na khams dang skye mched dag la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na khams dang skye mched dag la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then elements and sense bases would also be subject to the same consequence.

original: phung po rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan bshad zin to //üîΩrim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs//
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan bshad zin to // rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs//
translated: The other aspects of the aggregates have already been explained.üîΩORDERüîΩThe order is that of their coarseness,

original: snod sogs don khams ji bzhin no //
analyzed: snod sogs don khams ji bzhin no //
translated: their role in wrongdoing, and the order in which they are taught.

original: gzugs ni thogs pa dang ba cas pa'i phyir thams cad pas rags so //
analyzed: gzugs ni thogs pa dang ba cas pa'i phyir thams cad pas rags so //
translated: Form is the coarsest of all because it is impeded and can be broken.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi nang na yang tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi nang na yang tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Among the non-physical aggregates, feeling is the coarsest because it is the most active.

original: 'di ltar nga'i lag pa la tshor ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i lag pa la tshor ro //
translated: Thus, one designates: ‚ÄúI feel in my hand,

original: nga'i rkang pa la tshor ro zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: nga'i rkang pa la tshor ro zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: I feel in my foot.‚Äù

original: 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags so //
analyzed: 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags so //
translated: Feeling is coarser than perception.

original: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed de /
translated: Formations are coarser than consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gang ches rags pa de sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang ches rags pa de sngar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, that which is coarser is explained first.

original: yang na thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: yang na thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Moreover, in beginningless samsara, men and women are mutually attracted to each other‚Äôs form.

original: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because they are attached to the taste of feeling.

original: / de la chags pa yang 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la chags pa yang 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This attachment is due to the perversion of perception.

original: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
translated: This perversion is due to the defilements.

original: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: And the mind is defiled by them. Thus, the order of the defilements is in accordance with the order of coarseness.

original: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te /
translated: Or else, it is in the sense of a receptacle, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni snod dang zas dang tshod ma dang byan po dang za ba po lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni snod dang zas dang tshod ma dang byan po dang za ba po lta bu'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are like a pot, food, a vegetable, a cook, and one who eats.

original: yang na khams kyis te 'dod ba'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: yang na khams kyis te 'dod ba'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: Or else, the realms are the reason: the realm of desire is distinguished by the object of desire, form.

original: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so //
analyzed: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so //
translated: The absorptions are distinguished by feeling.

original: 'du shes kyis @37b rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis @37b rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
translated: The three formless realms are distinguished by ideation.

original: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
translated: The peak of cyclic existence is distinguished by the mere formation of volition.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin la /
translated: These are the abodes of consciousness,üîΩand consciousness resides in them.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes phung po'i go rims zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes phung po'i go rims zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order of the aggregates is taught to be like the order of a field and seeds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phung po rnams ni lnga ste mi nyung mi mang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po rnams ni lnga ste mi nyung mi mang ngo //
translated: That is why there are five aggregates, neither more nor less.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni ches rags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims kyi rgyu dang zas dang tshod ma lta bu dang / de dag gi khams gnyis rab tu phye ba'i go rims kyi rgyu de nyid kyi phyir tshor ba dang 'du shes dag ni 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu phung por byas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni ches rags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims kyi rgyu dang zas dang tshod ma lta bu dang / de dag gi khams gnyis rab tu phye ba'i go rims kyi rgyu de nyid kyi phyir tshor ba dang 'du shes dag ni 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu phung por byas so //
translated: Because these are the most gross, because they are the cause of the order of defilement, like food and drink, and because they are the cause of the order of the division of the two realms, feeling and perception are distinguished as separate aggregates from the formations.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang skye mched drug gi ge rims brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang skye mched drug gi ge rims brjod par bya ste /
translated: The order of the six elements and six spheres of sense is to be stated.

original: de'i dbang nyid kyis na de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi go rims su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang nyid kyis na de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi go rims su 'gyur ro //
translated: The order of the objects and consciousnesses is due to the order of the faculties.

original: drug po de dag las /üîΩda lta'i don phyir dang por lnga ;
analyzed: drug po de dag las / da lta'i don phyir dang por lnga ;
translated: Among the six,üîΩfive are first because of present objects.

original: / mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ni da ltar yin pa'i phyir sngar smos so //
analyzed: / mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ni da ltar yin pa'i phyir sngar smos so //
translated: The five beginning with the eye are mentioned first because their objects are present.

original: yid kyi yul ma nges pa can yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi yul ma nges pa can yin te /
translated: The object of the mental faculty is not fixed.

original: kha cig gi yul ni da ltar yin pa nas /
analyzed: kha cig gi yul ni da ltar yin pa nas /
translated: The object of some is present.

original: kha cig gi yul ni dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'i par yin no //
analyzed: kha cig gi yul ni dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'i par yin no //
translated: The object of some is of the three times and not of the three times.

original: 'byung ba las gyur don phyir bzhi //üîΩdang por zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur don phyir bzhi // dang por zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The first four are objects derived from the elements.

original: lnga rnams las kyang bzhir sngar smos pa ni yul 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga rnams las kyang bzhir sngar smos pa ni yul 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first four are mentioned first because their object is derived from the elements.

original: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te /üîΩres 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te / res 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag yin la /
translated: The object of the body is not determined.üîΩSometimes it is the elements,

original: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: sometimes it is derived from the elements,

original: res 'ga' ni gnyi ga yin no //üîΩgzhan ni ches ring myur 'jug phyir //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyi ga yin no // gzhan ni ches ring myur 'jug phyir //
translated: and sometimes it is both.üîΩThe others are mentioned first because they engage their objects at a greater distance and more quickly.

original: lhag ma ni ci rigs par ches rgyang ring ba dang myur bar 'jug pas gzhan bas sngar smos te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni ci rigs par ches rgyang ring ba dang myur bar 'jug pas gzhan bas sngar smos te /
translated: The others are mentioned first because they engage their objects at a greater distance and more quickly, as is appropriate.

original: mig dang rna ba'i yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas de dag sngar smos so //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas de dag sngar smos so //
translated: The eye and ear are mentioned first because their objects are at a greater distance.

original: de gnyis las kyang mig ni ches rgyang ring po la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang mig ni ches rgyang ring po la 'jug ste /
translated: Among those two, the eye engages its object at a greater distance.

original: chu klung rgyang ring po nas mthong yang de'i sgra mi thos pas de'i phyir de sngar smos so //
analyzed: chu klung rgyang ring po nas mthong yang de'i sgra mi thos pas de'i phyir de sngar smos so //
translated: The river is seen from afar, but its sound is not heard.

original: sna dang lce ni rgyang ring po la 'jug pa med mod kyi /üîΩde gnyis las kyang sna ni ches myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir sngar smos te /
analyzed: sna dang lce ni rgyang ring po la 'jug pa med mod kyi / de gnyis las kyang sna ni ches myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir sngar smos te /
translated: The nose and the tongue do not reach out to a distant object.

original: zas lce dang ma phrad pa nyid kyi dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas lce dang ma phrad pa nyid kyi dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the nose acts more quickly than the tongue, for the nose seizes the odor of food before the tongue seizes the taste of food.

original: yang na ji ltar gnas bzhin @38a * //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gnas bzhin @38a * //
translated: Or else, the order of the sense faculties is explained according to their location.

original: rim ; / yang na lus 'di la mig gi rten ni dang po na gnas so //
analyzed: rim ; / yang na lus 'di la mig gi rten ni dang po na gnas so //
translated: The eye sense faculty is located in the part of the body which is the highest,

original: de'i 'og na ni rna ba'i 'o //üîΩde'i 'og na ni sna'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og na ni rna ba'i 'o // de'i 'og na ni sna'i 'o //
translated: then the ear sense faculty,üîΩthen the nose sense faculty,

original: de'i 'og na ni lce'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og na ni lce'i 'o //
translated: then the tongue sense faculty.

original: lus kyi ni phal cher de'i 'og na'o //
analyzed: lus kyi ni phal cher de'i 'og na'o //
translated: The body sense faculty is located in the part of the body which is the largest.

original: yid ni de dag la brten pa dang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid ni de dag la brten pa dang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mental faculty is not located in a specific place, for it is not material form.

original: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yin no /
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yin no /
translated: The order of the sense faculties is thus explained according to their location.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i skye mched bcu po dag las gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i skye mched bcu po dag las gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod la /
translated: Again, why are the ten bases that are included in the form aggregate called the form base?

original: thams cad kyang chos kyi rang bzhin yin na gcig chos kyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyang chos kyi rang bzhin yin na gcig chos kyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /
translated: And if all are the nature of mental phenomena, why is one called the phenomena base?üîΩThey are called bases because they are distinct,

original: smras pa / bye brag don dang gtso po'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / bye brag don dang gtso po'i phyir //
translated: because they are the principal objects,üîΩbecause many phenomena are included,

original: chos mang ba dang mchog bsdus phyir //
analyzed: chos mang ba dang mchog bsdus phyir //
translated: and because they are supreme.üîΩOne is called the form base,

original: gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched dang // gcig ni chos zhes bya bar brjod //
analyzed: gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched dang // gcig ni chos zhes bya bar brjod //
translated: and one is called the phenomena base.

original: bye brag gi don ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag gi don ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of distinct?

original: ci nas kyang yul dang yul can nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bcu po 'di dag gi so sor skye mched nyid yin gyi spyir ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: ci nas kyang yul dang yul can nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bcu po 'di dag gi so sor skye mched nyid yin gyi spyir ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba yin la /
translated: These ten are distinct bases because they are posited as objects and possessors of objects, but they are not bases in general.

original: mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis ni gang mig la sogs par ni ming ma btags la gzugs ni yin pa de gzugs kyi skye mched du shes par 'gyur bas 'di'i ming gzhan ma brjod do //üîΩyang na gzugs kyi skye mched ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis ni gang mig la sogs par ni ming ma btags la gzugs ni yin pa de gzugs kyi skye mched du shes par 'gyur bas 'di'i ming gzhan ma brjod do // yang na gzugs kyi skye mched ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The other sense bases are named after their specific characteristics, but form is not named after its specific characteristic, since the eye, etc. are not named after their specific characteristics.üîΩOr else, the form sense base is mentioned first because it is the most important.

original: de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg na gzugs su rung ba dang / bstan du rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ni 'di na'o //üîΩche ge mo zhig na'o zhes brtag tu rung ba'i phyir ro//üîΩ'jig rten na yang de gzugs so zhes grags kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //üîΩbye brag gi don nyid kyis gcig ni chos kyi skye mched du bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg na gzugs su rung ba dang / bstan du rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ni 'di na'o //üîΩche ge mo zhig na'o zhes brtag tu rung ba'i phyir ro//üîΩ'jig rten na yang de gzugs so zhes grags kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //üîΩbye brag gi don nyid kyis gcig ni chos kyi skye mched du bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po rnams bsdus te /

eye consciousness of beings of the first meditative stabilization, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the second meditative stabilization, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the form realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the desire realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the form realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the desire realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the form realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the desire realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the form realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the desire realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the form realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the formless realm, because it is the object of the eye consciousness of beings of the desire realm

original: de'i phyir chos kyi sgrar spyir rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi sgrar spyir rjod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the word dharma is used in a general way.

original: chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa de yang der bsdus te gzhan dag tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa de yang der bsdus te gzhan dag tu ni ma yin no //
translated: And the supreme dharma, i.e., nirvƒÅ·πáa, is included in the aggregate of formations, but not in the other aggregates.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam pa nyi shu'i rig pa'i phyir dang / sha'i dang lha'i dang 'phags pa'i shes rab dang mig gsum gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir gcig gzugs kyi skye @38b mched du bstan to zhes zer ro //
