analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam pa nyi shu'i rig pa'i phyir dang / sha'i dang lha'i dang 'phags pa'i shes rab dang mig gsum gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir gcig gzugs kyi skye @38b mched du bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, one of the twenty-two controlling faculties, i.e., the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown, is the controlling faculty that is the most important in the first stage.

original: mdo dag las phung po dang skye mched dang khams zhes bya ba gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang dmigs na /
analyzed: mdo dag las phung po dang skye mched dang khams zhes bya ba gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang dmigs na /
translated: In the s≈´tras, other aggregates, other controlling faculties, other elements are mentioned.

original: ci de rnams 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus sam /
analyzed: ci de rnams 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus sam /
translated: Are these included in the aggregates, etc., mentioned above?

original: 'on te tha dad pa zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Or are they distinct?üîΩThey are included in the aggregates, etc., mentioned above; they are not distinct.

original: 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus kyi tha dad pa ni med de de la re zhig / chos kyi phung po brgyad khri dag / gang rnams thub pas gsungs de dag / tshig gam ming yin de dag ni //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus kyi tha dad pa ni med de de la re zhig / chos kyi phung po brgyad khri dag / gang rnams thub pas gsungs de dag / tshig gam ming yin de dag ni //
translated: The Fortunate One has taught that there are eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma. Are these the s≈´tras, etc.?

original: gzugs dang 'du byed dag tu 'dus //
analyzed: gzugs dang 'du byed dag tu 'dus //
translated: They are included in the aggregate of form and the aggregate of formations.

original: gang dag gi ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshig gi rang bzhin yin ba de dag gi ltar na de dag ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so//
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshig gi rang bzhin yin ba de dag gi ltar na de dag ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so//
translated: According to those who maintain that the speech of the Buddha is by nature sound, it is included in the aggregate of form.

original: gang dag gi ltar na ming gi rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi ltar na ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na ming gi rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi ltar na ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: According to those who maintain that it is by nature name, it is included in the aggregate of formations.

original: yang chos kyi phung po'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: yang chos kyi phung po'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a dharmak·π£a·πáa?

original: kha cig bstan bcos tshad ces zer //
analyzed: kha cig bstan bcos tshad ces zer //
translated: Some say: The measure of a treatise.

original: kha cig na re de ni chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba bstan bcos mngon pa'i tshad tsam mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba bstan bcos mngon pa'i tshad tsam mo zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: A dharmak·π£a·πáa is the measure of a treatise called the Aggregate of Dharma.

original: de ni shlo ka drug stong ngo //
analyzed: de ni shlo ka drug stong ngo //
translated: That is six thousand ≈õlokas.

original: yang gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //üîΩzhes zer te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //üîΩzhes zer te /
translated: Each topic is a k·π£a·πáa.

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / bden pa dang / zas dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / bden pa dang / zas dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang /
translated: Each of the topics of the aggregates, sense bases, elements, dependent origination, truths, sustenances, meditative stabilizations, immeasurables, formless states, liberations, subjugating sense bases,

original: zad par gyi skye mched dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud re re ni chos kyi phung po'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud re re ni chos kyi phung po'o zhes zer ro //
translated: bases of mastery, bases of totality, factors of enlightenment, superknowledges, analytical knowledges, knowledge through prayer, and so on is a Dharma aggregate.

original: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
translated: The antidote to the conduct of sentient beings

original: chos kyi phung po mthun par gsungs //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po mthun par gsungs //
translated: is said to be the Dharma aggregate.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: sems can rnams kyi spyod pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang nga rgyal la sogs pa spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri yod de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi spyod pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang nga rgyal la sogs pa spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri yod de /
translated: There are eighty thousand different conducts of sentient beings, such as attachment, anger, delusion, pride and so on.

original: de dag gi gnyen por bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs so zhes brjod do //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught 84,000 Dharma aggregates as antidotes to those.

original: ji ltar chos kyi phung po brgyad khri 'di phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid du bsdus pa /
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi phung po brgyad khri 'di phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid du bsdus pa /
translated: How are these 84,000 aggregates subsumed in these five aggregates?

original: de bzhin gzhan yang ci rigs par //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan yang ci rigs par //
translated: And likewise, the others should be included as appropriate.

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams ni //üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid legs dpyad de //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams ni // rang gi mtshan nyid legs dpyad de //
translated: The aggregates, bases, and elements

original: @39a * // ji skad bshad par bsdu par bya //
analyzed: @39a * // ji skad bshad par bsdu par bya //
translated: should be well analyzed according to their characteristicsüîΩand included in these aggregates and so on as explained.

original: mdo gzhan dag las phung po dang skye mched dang khams gzhan gang dag gsungs pa de dag kyang bstan bcos 'di las /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las phung po dang skye mched dang khams gzhan gang dag gsungs pa de dag kyang bstan bcos 'di las /
translated: In other s≈´tras, other aggregates, bases, and elements are taught.üîΩThose should be included in these aggregates and so on as explained here,

original: ji skad bshad pa bzhin de dag gi rang rang gi mtshan nyid legs par dpyad nas phung po la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa 'di dag nyid du bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin de dag gi rang rang gi mtshan nyid legs par dpyad nas phung po la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa 'di dag nyid du bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: having well analyzed their individual characteristics as explained in this treatise.

original: de la re zhig tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dag las tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: de la re zhig tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dag las tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: The aggregate of morality is included in the aggregate of form.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: The remaining four are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu po dag las brgyad ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu po dag las brgyad ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: Eight of the ten spheres of totality are included in the sense sphere of mental objects, because they are by nature non-greed.

original: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus te /
translated: If they are considered together with their associated elements, they are included in the sense spheres of the mental faculty and mental objects, because they are by nature the five aggregates.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the spheres of mastery.

original: zad par nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po dag ni phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po dag ni phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The bases of infinite space and infinite consciousness, which are the bases of totality, and the four formless meditative attainments, beginning with infinite space, are included in the mental faculty and the entity base, because they are by nature the four aggregates.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga po dag ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga po dag ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: The five bases of liberation are included in the entity base, because they are by nature wisdom.

original: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: If they are considered together with their retinue, they are included in the sound, mental faculty, and entity bases.

original: skye mched gnyis las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni dri dang ro'i skye mched bcu bzhi po rnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni dri dang ro'i skye mched bcu bzhi po rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: Beings devoid of discernment are included in the fourteen bases that are not form, because they are devoid of form.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
translated: Those who proceed to the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment are included in the mental faculty and entity bases.

original: de bzhin du khams mang po la las khams drug cu rtsa gnyis bstan pa de dag kyang ci rigs par bsdu par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams mang po la las khams drug cu rtsa gnyis bstan pa de dag kyang ci rigs par bsdu par rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the six elements of the six sense faculties should be understood as included in the six elements of the eye, etc.

original: der gang dag sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug bstan pa la /
analyzed: der gang dag sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug bstan pa la /
translated: The six elements of the earth element, etc.,

original: de dag las gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na /üîΩde ci nam mkha' nyid @39b nam mkha'i khams yin la /
analyzed: de dag las gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na / de ci nam mkha' nyid @39b nam mkha'i khams yin la /
translated: are not explained as having distinct characteristics.üîΩAre space and consciousness the only elements that are not explained as having distinct characteristics?

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yin par rig par bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yin par rig par bya 'am zhe na /
translated: Are space and consciousness the only elements that are not explained as having distinct characteristics?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩsgo dang skar khung dang kha dang sna la sogs pa'i bu ga nam mkha'i khams zhes bya /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / sgo dang skar khung dang kha dang sna la sogs pa'i bu ga nam mkha'i khams zhes bya /
translated: What then?üîΩThe cavities of the eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and the cavities of the stomach, intestines, etc., are called the space element.

original: bu ga zhes bya ba ci zhig yin par rig par bya /
analyzed: bu ga zhes bya ba ci zhig yin par rig par bya /
translated: What is a cavity?

original: snang dang mun ba dag yin lo //
analyzed: snang dang mun ba dag yin lo //
translated: It is the absence of matter.

original: bu ga ni snang ba dang mun pa dag las gzhan du gzung du med do //
analyzed: bu ga ni snang ba dang mun pa dag las gzhan du gzung du med do //
translated: A hole is not perceived as being different from light and darkness.

original: de lta bas na nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang mun pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang mun pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Thus the element of space is the nature of light and darkness.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin du yin par rig par bya'o zhes grag go //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin du yin par rig par bya'o zhes grag go //
translated: It should be understood as having the nature of night and day.

original: de nyid thogs pa'i nye ba'i 'khor gyi gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid thogs pa'i nye ba'i 'khor gyi gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the form of the sphere of obstruction.

original: thogs ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir bsags par gnas pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: thogs ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir bsags par gnas pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Obstruction means form that exists in an aggregated state, because it is very suitable to be damaged.

original: de ni de'i 'khor ro lo //üîΩgzhan dag na re de la gzhan mi thogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni de'i 'khor ro lo // gzhan dag na re de la gzhan mi thogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is its sphere.üîΩOthers say that it is because another form does not obstruct it.

original: de ni thogs med kyang yin la gzugs gzhan gyi nye 'khor yang yin pas thogs med nye 'khor yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam shes ni /
analyzed: de ni thogs med kyang yin la gzugs gzhan gyi nye 'khor yang yin pas thogs med nye 'khor yin no zhes zer ro // zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam shes ni /
translated: Since it is unobstructed and is the sphere of another form, it is the unobstructed sphere.

original: rnam shes khams yin /
analyzed: rnam shes khams yin /
translated: The consciousness element is the six consciousnesses.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the uncontaminated not considered to be an element?

original: 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni /
translated: Because these six elements

original: skye ba'i rten yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: skye ba'i rten yin par 'dod de /
translated: The four primary elements are the basis of arising.

original: de dag nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi ba'i sems kyi bar du skye ba'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi ba'i sems kyi bar du skye ba'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
translated: From the moment of conception until the moment of death, the primary elements are the basis of arising of the mind and the mental factors.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar na de dag las khams bzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyi nang du 'dus so //üîΩlnga pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no // de'i phyir de ltar na de dag las khams bzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyi nang du 'dus so // lnga pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi nang du 'dus so //
translated: This is not the case for the pure factors.

original: drug pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun po dag tu 'dus so //
analyzed: drug pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun po dag tu 'dus so //
translated: Thus, among the eighteen elements, four are included in the tangible-object element, one is included in the visible-form element, six are included in the seven elements of consciousness, and seven are included in the element of factors.

original: gang dag khams bco brgyad bstan pa de dag las bstan du yod pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: gang dag khams bco brgyad bstan pa de dag las bstan du yod pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are visible?

original: bstan du med pa rnams ni du zhe na /üîΩbstan yod 'dir ni gzugs gcig tu //üîΩde ni 'di ni 'di na 'o //
analyzed: bstan du med pa rnams ni du zhe na / bstan yod 'dir ni gzugs gcig tu // de ni 'di ni 'di na 'o //
translated: How many are invisible?üîΩOne element is visible.

original: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus so //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus so //
translated: It is visible because it can be indicated as here or there.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other elements are invisible.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are resistant?

original: thogs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are unimpeded?

original: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
analyzed: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
translated: Ten are impeded and material.

original: gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i khams bcu gang dag bshad pa de dag ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te /üîΩthogs pa @40a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i khams bcu gang dag bshad pa de dag ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te / thogs pa @40a * //
translated: The ten elements that were said to be included in the form aggregate are impeded.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa'o //
translated: Obstruction is hindrance.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three kinds:

original: sgrib pa dang yul dang dmigs pa la thogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang yul dang dmigs pa la thogs pa'o //
translated: obstruction as resistance, obstruction as object, and obstruction as support.

original: de la sgrib pa la thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste /üîΩdper na lag pa 'am /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa la thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste / dper na lag pa 'am /
translated: Among these, obstruction as resistance is the hindrance to the arising of one entity in the place occupied by another.

original: rdo ba la lag pa rdugs shig thogs pa'am /
analyzed: rdo ba la lag pa rdugs shig thogs pa'am /
translated: For example, the hand is obstructed by a wall,

original: rdo ba yang de gnyis la thogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdo ba yang de gnyis la thogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the wall is obstructed by the hand.

original: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa yul can rnams gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la thogs pa ste /
analyzed: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa yul can rnams gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la thogs pa ste /
translated: Obstruction as object is the obstruction of the eye and so on by form and so on.

original: btags pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: btags pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Praj√±apti≈õƒÅstra declares:

original: chu la thogs pa la skam lam yin pa'i mig kyang yod de /
analyzed: chu la thogs pa la skam lam yin pa'i mig kyang yod de /
translated: There is an eye that is obstructed by water but not by land,

original: dper na nya rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nya rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: like that of fish.

original: skam thogs la chu la ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: skam thogs la chu la ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also that which is impeded to dry land but not water,

original: mi phal che ba'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi phal che ba'i lta bu'o //
translated: like most humans.

original: gnyi gar thogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi gar thogs pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is impeded to both,

original: chu srin byis pa gsod pa dang / sbal pa dang / sha za ba dang / nya pa la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod pa dang / sbal pa dang / sha za ba dang / nya pa la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: like the makara, frog, flesh-eater, fisherman, and so on.

original: gnyi gar ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi gar ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is impeded to neither,

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: except for those mentioned above.

original: mig gang mtshan mo thogs la nyin par ma yin pa yod de /
analyzed: mig gang mtshan mo thogs la nyin par ma yin pa yod de /
translated: There is that which is impeded at night but not during the day,

original: pha wang dang / 'ug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: pha wang dang / 'ug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: like the bat, owl, and so on.

original: nyin par thogs la mtshan mo ma yin pa ni mi phal che'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyin par thogs la mtshan mo ma yin pa ni mi phal che'i lta bu'o //
translated: There is that which is impeded during the day but not at night, like most humans.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin par thogs ba ni khyi dang / wa dang / rta dang / gung dang / byi la la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin par thogs ba ni khyi dang / wa dang / rta dang / gung dang / byi la la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: There is that which is impeded both at night and during the day, like dogs, foxes, horses, leopards, cats, and so on.

original: gnyi gar yang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnyi gar yang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: There is that which is impeded to neither, except for those mentioned above.

original: 'di ni yul la thogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yul la thogs pa'o //
translated: This is impediment to objects.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rang gi dmigs pa dag la thogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rang gi dmigs pa dag la thogs pa'o //
translated: The obstacle of the object-field is the obstacle of the mind and mental activities with regard to their own object-field.

original: yul dang dmigs pa dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yul dang dmigs pa dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the object-field and the object?

original: gang la gang zhig byed pa de ni yul yin la /
analyzed: gang la gang zhig byed pa de ni yul yin la /
translated: The object-field is that in regard to which something is exercised.

original: gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa de ni dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa de ni dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The object is that which is grasped by the mind and mental activities.

original: yang ji ltar na rang gi yul la dmigs pa la 'jug pa la thogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rang gi yul la dmigs pa la 'jug pa la thogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can the mind and mental activities be said to be obstructed in regard to their own object-field?

original: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na 'di la gtod pa ni thogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro // yang na 'di la gtod pa ni thogs pa yin te /
translated: Because they do not function elsewhere.

original: rang gi yul la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the obstacle is that which impedes the mind and mental activities from being directed toward the object-field.üîΩThat is to say, the obstacle is that which impedes the mind and mental activities from functioning in regard to their own object-field.

original: de lta bas na 'dir bcu po dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir bcu po dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in this context, the ten are said to be with obstacle because they are obstructed by the obstacle of the object-field,

original: phan tshun sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they mutually obstruct each other.

original: chos gang dag yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag sgrib pa la @40b thogs pas kyang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang dag yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag sgrib pa la @40b thogs pas kyang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are the factors that are impeded by object-field also impeded by the object-field?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni sems kyi khams bdun dag dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni sems kyi khams bdun dag dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first alternative is the seven elements of thought and the part of the element of factors associated with thought.

original: gnyis pa ni yul lnga po dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yul lnga po dag go //
translated: The second alternative is the five object-fields.

original: gsum pa ni dbang po lnga dag go //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dbang po lnga dag go //
translated: The third alternative is the five sense faculties.

original: bzhi pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa chos kyi khams kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa chos kyi khams kyi phyogs so //
translated: The fourth alternative is the part of the element of factors that is not associated with thought.

original: gang dag yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag nyid dmigs pa la thogs bas kyang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag nyid dmigs pa la thogs bas kyang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are the factors that are impeded by object-field also impeded by the object-field?

original: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: The answer is:

original: re zhig dmigs pa la thogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul la thogs pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dmigs pa la thogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul la thogs pas kyang yin no //
translated: Those that are impeded by the object-field are also impeded by the object-field.

original: yul la thogs pas yin la dmigs pa la thogs pas ma yin pa yang yod de dbang po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: yul la thogs pas yin la dmigs pa la thogs pas ma yin pa yang yod de dbang po lnga rnams so //
translated: There are factors that are impeded by the object-field but not impeded by the object-field, namely, the five sense faculties.

original: btsun pa gzhon nu lan na re ni gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la gzhan dag gis thogs par byed nus pa de ni thogs pa dang bcas ba yin par shes par bya la /
analyzed: btsun pa gzhon nu lan na re ni gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la gzhan dag gis thogs par byed nus pa de ni thogs pa dang bcas ba yin par shes par bya la /
translated: Bhadanta-SÃÅrƒ±ÃÑlÃáata says: That which can be obstructed by another when one wishes to generate mind is to be understood as obstructed.

original: bzlog pa ni thogs pa med par 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni thogs pa med par 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The opposite is asserted to be unobstructed.

original: thogs ba dang bcas pa dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: thogs ba dang bcas pa dag bshad zin to //
translated: Those that are obstructed have been explained.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag las dge ba rnams ni du /üîΩyi dge ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag las dge ba rnams ni du / yi dge ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are virtuous?üîΩHow many are nonvirtuous?

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are neutral?

original: lung ma bstan brgyad /
analyzed: lung ma bstan brgyad /
translated: Eight are neutral.

original: brgyad po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad po dag gang zhe na /
translated: Which eight?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa bcu bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa bcu bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: Those ten that are said to be obstructed

original: de dag nyid /
analyzed: de dag nyid /
translated: are neutral.

original: gzugs sgra ma gtogs dbang po lnga rnams dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams dang brgyad po de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung bstan du med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ma gtogs dbang po lnga rnams dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams dang brgyad po de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung bstan du med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
translated: The five faculties, excluding form and sound, and the elements of smell, taste, and tactile objects are neutral because they are not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gzhan dag na re ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung bstan du med pa'i phyir zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung bstan du med pa'i phyir zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: Because they are not declared to be karmic maturation.

original: de ltar na ni zag pa med pa la thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zag pa med pa la thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the uncontaminated would be a consequence.

original: gzhan rnam gsum /
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum /
translated: The other ten are of three types.

original: gzhan khams bcu po dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan khams bcu po dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yin te /
translated: The other ten elements are virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate.

original: de la sems kyi khams bdun ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba dag ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: de la sems kyi khams bdun ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba dag ni dge ba yin no //
translated: Among them, the seven mental elements are virtuous when they are concomitant with nonattachment and so on.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba yin no //
translated: They are nonvirtuous when they are concomitant with attachment and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni lung du ma bstan ba yin no //üîΩchos kyi khams ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba dang / so sor @41a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lung du ma bstan ba yin no // chos kyi khams ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba dang / so sor @41a * //
translated: The others are indeterminate.

original: brtags pas 'gog pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pas 'gog pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu is virtuous when it is the intrinsic state of nonattachment and so on, when it is concomitant with nonattachment and so on, when it is motivated by nonattachment and so on, and when it is analytical cessation.üîΩIt is nonvirtuous when it is the intrinsic state of attachment and so on, when it is concomitant with attachment and so on, when it is motivated by attachment and so on, and when it is the intrinsic state of the five obscurations.üîΩIt is indeterminate when it is the intrinsic state of the other two roots, when it is concomitant with them, when it is motivated by them, and when it is nonanalytical cessation.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs bar ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs bar ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: The unwholesome is that which is associated with attachment, etc., and that which is motivated by attachment, etc.

original: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The other is neutral.

original: gzugs dang sgra'i khams ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra'i khams ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin no //
translated: The elements of form and sound are wholesome or unwholesome when they are included in bodily and vocal informative action, when they are motivated by a wholesome or unwholesome thought.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The other elements are neutral.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bshad zin to //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bshad zin to //
translated: The wholesome, etc., have been explained.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag las 'dod par gtogs pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag las 'dod par gtogs pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements belong to the realm of desire?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many belong to the realm of form? How many belong to the formless realm?

original: 'dod khams gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dod khams gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All belong to the realm of desire.

original: gtogs pa ni ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: gtogs pa ni ma bral ba ste /
translated: Belonging means not being free from.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are associated with the realm of desire.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The realm of form has fourteen.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni khams bcu bzhi ste /üîΩdri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni khams bcu bzhi ste / dri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
translated: In the realm of form, there are fourteen elements.

original: lce'i rnam par shes khams ma gtogs //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes khams ma gtogs //
translated: The elements of odor and taste, and the nose and tongue consciousnesses do not exist there.

original: de na dri dang ro dag med //üîΩde gnyis ni khams kyi zas yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de na dri dang ro dag med // de gnyis ni khams kyi zas yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: There is no odor and no taste there,

original: de dag gi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang der skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang der skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the food of the element of resistance, and those who are free from attachment to them are born there.

original: de lta bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, the nose and tongue consciousnesses do not exist there, because their objects do not exist.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de ni rig bya'i khams kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de ni rig bya'i khams kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the element of factors also does not exist there,

original: khams kyi zas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams kyi zas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the food of the element of factors.

original: zas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa gang yin pa de de na yod do //
analyzed: zas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa gang yin pa de de na yod do //
translated: That which is not of the nature of food exists there.

original: dri dang ro dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri dang ro dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that odor and taste also exist there.

original: reg bya dbang po'i rten dang gzhi dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i dngos por yod du chug kyang zas mid pa med par dri dang ro dag la yongs su longs spyod pa med de /
analyzed: reg bya dbang po'i rten dang gzhi dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i dngos por yod du chug kyang zas mid pa med par dri dang ro dag la yongs su longs spyod pa med de /
translated: Although tangible objects exist as the basis and support of the body sense faculty and as clothing and so on, smell and taste are not experienced without swallowing food.

original: de lta bas na de na zas mid pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la dri dang ro dag dgos pa med kyi reg bya ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de na zas mid pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la dri dang ro dag dgos pa med kyi reg bya ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore those free from attachment to swallowing food do not need smell and taste, but they do need tangible objects.

original: gzhan dag na re ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas 'dir gzugs rnams kyang mthong zhing sgra rnams kyang thos la shin tu sbyangs pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i reg bya'i khyad bar gyis kyang lus la phan 'dogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas 'dir gzugs rnams kyang mthong zhing sgra rnams kyang thos la shin tu sbyangs pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i reg bya'i khyad bar gyis kyang lus la phan 'dogs pas /
translated: Others say: In the desire realm, one sees form and hears sound in dependence on the meditative attainment of absorption dhyana and the special tangible objects concomitant with pliancy also benefit the body.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i bsam gtan na gsum po de dag srid kyi /üîΩdri dang ro dag ni ma yin no zhes @41b zer ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i bsam gtan na gsum po de dag srid kyi / dri dang ro dag ni ma yin no zhes @41b zer ro ;
translated: Therefore those three exist in the absorptions of birth,üîΩbut smell and taste do not.

original: / de lta na ni 'o na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de lta na ni 'o na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the nose and tongue sense faculties would not exist there.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would serve no purpose.

original: dgos pa yod de /
analyzed: dgos pa yod de /
translated: It does serve a purpose.

original: de dag med par ni rten mdzes pa nyid dang / mngon bar brjod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag med par ni rten mdzes pa nyid dang / mngon bar brjod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For, without them, the body would not be beautiful and speech would not be possible.

original: gal te dgos pa der zad na mdzes par bya ba'i don dang / tshig gi don du rten kho nas chog gi dbang po ni dgos pa med do //
analyzed: gal te dgos pa der zad na mdzes par bya ba'i don dang / tshig gi don du rten kho nas chog gi dbang po ni dgos pa med do //
translated: If that were the only purpose of the faculties, then the body alone would suffice as the basis of beauty and speech, and the faculties would serve no purpose.

original: dbang po med pa'i rten ni mi srid de /
analyzed: dbang po med pa'i rten ni mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for a body to exist without faculties,

original: pho'i dbang po'i rten bzhin no //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po'i rten bzhin no //
translated: like the body of a eunuch.

original: de ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi srid par rigs kyi sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten ni dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi srid par rigs kyi sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten ni dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pas /
translated: It is possible for a body to exist without the faculties of nose and tongue, because the body of a eunuch exists without the male organ.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni dbang po med par yang srid par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni dbang po med par yang srid par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the body can exist without the faculties of nose and tongue.

original: dgos pa med par yang dbang po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgos pa med par yang dbang po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Faculties can be produced without a purpose,

original: dper na mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: like the faculties of beings who die in the womb.

original: dgos pa med pa yin mod kyi rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa yin mod kyi rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: Although they are without purpose, they are not without cause.

original: dbang po skye ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po skye ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the arising of the faculties?

original: dbang po la sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi khyad par ro //
translated: It is a special action associated with craving for the faculties.

original: gang yang yul la sred pa dang bral ba de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po las kyang sred pa dang bral ba yin pas de dag gi yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sna dang lce'i dbang po dag 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin no
analyzed: gang yang yul la sred pa dang bral ba de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po las kyang sred pa dang bral ba yin pas de dag gi yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sna dang lce'i dbang po dag 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin no
translated: Those who are free from craving for the object are also free from craving for the faculty. Therefore, it is not proper that those who are free from attachment to the object have the nose and tongue faculties.

original: // yang na pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: // yang na pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur /
translated: Or else, why would the male faculty not arise?

original: mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ugly.

original: mdoms kyi spa ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir mi mdzes par 'gyur /
analyzed: mdoms kyi spa ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir mi mdzes par 'gyur /
translated: But it is not ugly for those whose sexual organ is hidden in a sheath.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise by the power of a need.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rgyu'i dbang gis 'byung bas rgyu yod na mi mdzes par byed bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang gis 'byung bas rgyu yod na mi mdzes par byed bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It arises by the power of a cause. If there is a cause, it arises even if it is ugly.

original: 'o na ni mdo las dbang po rnams mtshang ba med cing med pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni mdo las dbang po rnams mtshang ba med cing med pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: But this contradicts the sutra, which says, ‚ÄúThe faculties are not impaired and are not absent.

original: de na dbang po gang dag srid pa de dag gis dbang po med pa ma yin bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de na dbang po gang dag srid pa de dag gis dbang po med pa ma yin bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: ‚Äù What contradiction? The faculties that exist there do not make the faculties absent.

original: de lta ma yin na pho'i dbang po yang yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na pho'i dbang po yang yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the male faculty would also exist there.

original: 'di skad du lus kyi sgo nas skye mched drug la sred pa kun du spyod kyi yul gyi sgo nas ni ma yin bas de na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag ni yod pa nyid kyi dri dang ro dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du lus kyi sgo nas skye mched drug la sred pa kun du spyod kyi yul gyi sgo nas ni ma yin bas de na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag ni yod pa nyid kyi dri dang ro dag ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said that craving is practiced in relation to the six sense bases through the body, not through the object. Therefore, the nose and tongue faculties exist there, but not their objects, smell and taste.

original: pho'i dbang po ni 'khrig @42a * //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po ni 'khrig @42a * //
translated: The male faculty is practiced through the craving of sexual intercourse.

original: pa reg pa'i sgo nas sred pa kun tu spyod pas de lta bas na gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i khams bcu bzhi'o zhes bya ba de grub po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: pa reg pa'i sgo nas sred pa kun tu spyod pas de lta bas na gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i khams bcu bzhi'o zhes bya ba de grub po zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there are fourteen elements belonging to the form realm.

original: gzugs med gtogs pa yid dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs med gtogs pa yid dang ni //
translated: The formless realm is associated with the mind,

original: chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: the mental object, and the mind consciousness.

original: khams gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye ste /
analyzed: khams gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye ste /
translated: Those who are detached from attachment to the form realm are born there.

original: de'i phyir de ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu dang de dag la rten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang med do //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu dang de dag la rten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang med do // zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: Therefore, the ten elements that are by nature form and the five elements of consciousness that have form as their basis and object do not exist there.üîΩHow many elements are contaminated?

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are uncontaminated?

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gang dag bshad pa /
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gang dag bshad pa /
translated: The mental faculty, mental objects, and the mental consciousness were explained above.

original: de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: These three are contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa de dag ni zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa de dag ni zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: Those that are included in the truth of the path and the unconditioned are uncontaminated.

original: gzhan dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩlhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no // lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
translated: The others are contaminated.

original: lhag ma khams bco lnga po de dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩrtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma khams bco lnga po de dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin no // rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: The remaining fifteen elements are solely contaminated.üîΩHow many elements are associated with investigation and associated with analysis?

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dag ni du /
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dag ni du /
translated: How many are not associated with investigation but are associated with analysis?

original: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not discursive and not investigative?

original: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
translated: Those that are discursive and investigative

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin ;
translated: are the five consciousnesses.

original: /'di dag ni rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di dag ni rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: These five consciousnesses are always associated with discursiveness and with investigation.

original: 'di ltar kha phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir rtsing ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar kha phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir rtsing ba yin no //
translated: Because they look outward, they are coarse.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates restriction.

original: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
translated: The last three are of three kinds.

original: tha ma dag ni yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
analyzed: tha ma dag ni yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
translated: The last three are the mental faculty, the entity constituent, and the mental consciousness.

original: gsum po de dag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gsum po de dag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: These three are of three kinds.

original: de la yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan ba chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan ba chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
translated: The mental faculty, the element of consciousness, and the element of mental objects, with the exception of initial inquiry and investigation, are associated with initial inquiry and investigation in the realm of desire and in the first meditation.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag yin no //
translated: In the special meditation, they are without initial inquiry and only with investigation.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the second meditation on up to the peak of cyclic existence,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi dang / chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan khyad par can @42b gyi dpyod pa ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi dang / chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan khyad par can @42b gyi dpyod pa ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
translated: the element of mental objects that is not associated with thought, and the investigation of the special meditation, are without initial inquiry and without investigation.

original: rtog pa ni rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa ni rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam yin no //
translated: Initial inquiry is always without initial inquiry and only with investigation, because there is no second initial inquiry, and because it is associated with investigation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi nang du mi 'dun de ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi nang du mi 'dun de ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: The investigation of the first meditation is not included in the three investigations of the realm of desire.

original: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam yin no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúwithout investigation, with only investigation,‚Äù because it is not associated with the second investigation and because it is associated with investigation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa na chos rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa na chos rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Therefore, in the stage with investigation and analysis, there are four types of dharmas.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa ma rtogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa ma rtogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: Those with investigation and analysis are dharmas that are associated with investigation and analysis, but are not investigation and analysis themselves.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag ni rtog pa'o //
translated: Those without investigation, but with only analysis, are investigation.

original: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: Those without investigation and analysis are dharmas that are not associated with investigation and analysis.

original: dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam ni dpyod pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam ni dpyod pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Those without investigation, but with only analysis, are analysis.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga spangs //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga spangs //
translated: The rest are abandoned in both ways.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag ste /
translated: The remaining ten elements are the ten physical elements.

original: de dag ni mtshungs par ldan ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshungs par ldan ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
translated: Since they are not associated with thought, they are always without initial inquiry and without investigation.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ba lnga po rnams rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ba lnga po rnams rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin na /
translated: If the five collections of consciousness are associated with initial inquiry and investigation,

original: ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya zhe na /üîΩnges par rtog dang rjes dran pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya zhe na / nges par rtog dang rjes dran pa'i //
translated: how can they be said to be without conceptualization?

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams mi rtog / rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams mi rtog / rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag ste /
translated: Conceptualization is of three types:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / nges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩde bas na de dag la ngo bo nyid kyi rtog pa yod kyi gzhan dag yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / nges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o // de bas na de dag la ngo bo nyid kyi rtog pa yod kyi gzhan dag yin te /
translated: conceptualization as essence, conceptualization as investigation, and conceptualization as memory.üîΩThe five collections of consciousness have the first type of conceptualization, but not the other two.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are said to be without conceptualization.

original: dper na rta rkang gcig pa la rkang med ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta rkang gcig pa la rkang med ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a one-footed animal is called ‚Äúwithout feet.‚Äù

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa yin te /
translated: Conceptualization by intrinsic nature is conceptualization.

original: de ni 'og nas sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas ston to //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas ston to //
translated: It will be explained later among the mental factors.

original: gzhan dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the others?

original: rim bzhin du /
analyzed: rim bzhin du /
translated: In order,

original: de dag yid kyi shes rab g-yeng ;
analyzed: de dag yid kyi shes rab g-yeng ;
translated: they are distraction of the mental faculty,

original: / yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //
analyzed: / yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //
translated: and all mindfulness of the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni yid kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni yid kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: Wisdom associated with mental consciousness is called mental.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Non-equipoise is called distraction.

original: de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩyid kyi dran pa nyid mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa @43a * //
analyzed: de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // yid kyi dran pa nyid mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa @43a * //
translated: That is conceptualization by investigation.

original: ma yin pa thams cad ni rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //üîΩdmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ma yin pa thams cad ni rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no // dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: All mindfulness of the mental faculty, whether in equipoise or not in equipoise, is conceptualization by recollection.

original: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many have objects and how many are without objects?

original: dmigs bcas sems kyi khams bdun no //
analyzed: dmigs bcas sems kyi khams bdun no //
translated: The seven mental elements have objects.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams dang / yid kyi khams te /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams dang / yid kyi khams te /
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental consciousnesses, and the mental faculty.

original: sems kyi khams bdun po de dag ni yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun po de dag ni yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: These seven mental constituents are said to have objects because they apprehend objects.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyang /
translated: The phenomena constituent

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: is also said to have objects.

original: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: That part of the phenomena constituent that is mental factors

original: lhag ma gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs ldan pa ma yin pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar grub bo //üîΩzin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs ldan pa ma yin pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar grub bo // zin pa rnams ni du /
translated: The remaining ten physical constituents and the part of the phenomena constituent that is not associated with the mind are established as not having objects.üîΩWhich are the ones that are appropriated?

original: ma zin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: ma zin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: Which are the ones that are not appropriated?

original: ma zin dgu /
analyzed: ma zin dgu /
translated: Nine are not appropriated.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: Which nine?

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa bdun brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa bdun brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: The seven that have objects, plus half of the eighth.

original: brgyad po de dag rnams dang sgra //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag rnams dang sgra //
translated: Those eight and sound.

original: de ltar na sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / khams dgu po de dag ni ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / khams dgu po de dag ni ma zin pa yin no //
translated: Thus nine elements are not appropriated: the seven elements of consciousness, the element of mental objects and the element of sound.

original: dgu po gzhan na rnam pa gnyis //üîΩzin pa dag kyang yin /
analyzed: dgu po gzhan na rnam pa gnyis // zin pa dag kyang yin /
translated: The other nine are of two kinds.

original: ma zin pa dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: ma zin pa dag kyang yin te /
translated: They are appropriated and not appropriated.

original: de la mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang da ltar byung ba rnams ni zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang da ltar byung ba rnams ni zin pa yin no //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body and the element of mental objects which are present are appropriated.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma zin pa yin no //
translated: The past and future ones are not appropriated.

original: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams da ltar byung ba dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni zin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams da ltar byung ba dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni zin pa yin no //
translated: The elements of form, smell, taste and the tangible which are present and are not distinct from the faculties are appropriated.

original: gzhan dag ni ma zin pa rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma zin pa rnams te /
translated: The others are not appropriated.

original: 'di lta ste rtsa ba ma gtogs pa'i skra dang / ba spu dang / sen mo dang / so dag la yod pa dang / phyis dang / gcin dang / mchil ma dang ; snabs dang / khrag la sogs pa dag la yod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rtsa ba ma gtogs pa'i skra dang / ba spu dang / sen mo dang / so dag la yod pa dang / phyis dang / gcin dang / mchil ma dang ; snabs dang / khrag la sogs pa dag la yod pa dang /
translated: For example, they exist in hair, body hair, nails, teeth, excrement, urine, saliva, mucus, blood, etc.,

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa dag la yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa dag la yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the earth, water, etc.

original: zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúappropriated‚Äù?

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos por nye bar gzung ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos por nye bar gzung ba ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors appropriate the material elements by taking possession of them, because they are favorable to the benefit or the harm of the mind.

original: 'jig rten gyi na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩkhams nga dag gcig ni 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o // khams nga dag gcig ni 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: In the world, what is called ‚Äúliving being‚Äù is the collection of the six sense-faculties.

original: du dag gcig ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du dag gcig ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many elements are derived from the primary elements? How many are primary elements?

original: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: Tangible things are of two kinds:

original: 'byung ba dag dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: primary and derived.

original: de la 'byung ba dag ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba dag ni bzhi'o //
translated: The primary elements are four in number.

original: 'byung ba @43b las gyur pa ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: 'byung ba @43b las gyur pa ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The seven kinds of tangibility, smoothness, etc. , are derived from the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called derived because they exist in dependence on the primary elements.

original: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni //
translated: The other nine material elements

original: 'byung gyur / dbang po lnga'i khams dag dang yul bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'byung gyur / dbang po lnga'i khams dag dang yul bzhi ste /
translated: The nine elements of the sense faculties and the four objects are derived from the great elements.

original: khams dgu po de rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dag kho na'o //üîΩchos khams phyogs gcig kyang /
analyzed: khams dgu po de rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dag kho na'o // chos khams phyogs gcig kyang /
translated: These nine elements are only derived from the great elements.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: One part of the element of mental objects is also derived from the great elements.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called non-revealing form.

original: lhag ma sems kyi khams bdun dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa chos kyi khams ni gnyis ga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma sems kyi khams bdun dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa chos kyi khams ni gnyis ga ma yin pa'o //
translated: The remaining seven elements of consciousness and the part of the element of mental objects that is not form are neither.

original: btsun pa sangs rgyas lha na re ni skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: btsun pa sangs rgyas lha na re ni skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam mo zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Buddhadeva says that the ten elements of the sense faculties are only the great elements.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: mdo las 'byung ba rnams ni bzhi nyid dang / sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba rnams ni bzhi nyid dang / sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir la /
translated: because the sutras definitely hold that the great elements are four in number and have the characteristics of solidity, etc.

original: de dag kyang reg bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang reg bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are also tangible objects.

original: mig la sogs pas kyang sra ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pas kyang sra ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin la /
translated: The eye element, etc., do not grasp solidity, etc.

original: lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The body faculty does not experience color and so on.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las kyang dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched yin te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, the eye is an internal sense base,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs dang ba gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ste lus kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs dang ba gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ste lus kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: which is subtle form derived from the four great elements, invisible and impeded. The same is true of the body.

original: dge slong gzugs rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gzugs rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, visible form is an external sense base,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no /
translated: which is derived from the four great elements, visible and impeded.

original: dge slong sgra ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong sgra ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, sound is an external sense base,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: which is derived from the four great elements, invisible and impeded.

original: dri dang ro yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dri dang ro yang de bzhin no //
translated: Smell and taste are also like this.

original: dge slong reg bya rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong reg bya rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, tactile objects are an external sense base,üîΩwhich is derived from the four great elements, invisible and impeded.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements that is not visible but has obstruction.

original: reg bya'i skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kho nas 'byung ba rnams bsdus pa'i phyir lhag ma rnams ni 'byung ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar kun du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kho nas 'byung ba rnams bsdus pa'i phyir lhag ma rnams ni 'byung ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar kun du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the elements are included in the sense base of tactility alone, it is clear that the remaining sense bases are not the elements.

original: 'o na mdo las /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las /
translated: But a sutra states:

original: gang mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba mkhrang bar gyur pa gang yin pa zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: gang mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba mkhrang bar gyur pa gang yin pa zhes gsungs so /
translated: What is the solidity and hardness of the fleshy mass of the eye?

original: de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i sha'i gong bu la de skad du bstan par zad do //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i sha'i gong bu la de skad du bstan par zad do //
translated: This is stated in terms of the fleshy mass that is not different from the elements.

original: mngal du 'jug pa las /
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa las /
translated: The Descent into the Womb Sutra states:

original: dge song 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge song 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, this is the six elements.

original: sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is stated in terms of the basis of sentient beings‚Äô substance.

original: yang reg pa'i skye mched drug ces gsungs pa'i @44a * //
analyzed: yang reg pa'i skye mched drug ces gsungs pa'i @44a * //
translated: Also, the six bases of contact are stated.

original: phyir dang / sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir dang / sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it would follow that mental factors do not exist.

original: sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to accept that mind itself is mental factors,üîΩbecause a sutra declares:üîΩThe phenomena of discernment and intention are mental factors that arise in dependence on mind,

original: mdo las ; 'du shes dang sems pa'i chos 'di ni sems las byung ba sems la brten pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las ; 'du shes dang sems pa'i chos 'di ni sems las byung ba sems la brten pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is said that mind arises with attachment and so on.

original: de lta bas na khams rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin yin no //üîΩbsags pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: de lta bas na khams rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin yin no // bsags pa rnams ni du /
translated: Thus the primary elements and derivative form exist as explained.üîΩWhich are aggregated and which are not?

original: bsags pa ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: bsags pa ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: Which are aggregated and which are not?

original: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o //
translated: Ten are aggregated.

original: dbang po'i khams lnga dang yul lnga dag ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir bsags pa dag go //
analyzed: dbang po'i khams lnga dang yul lnga dag ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir bsags pa dag go //
translated: The five sense faculties and the five objects are aggregated because they are composites of subtle particles.

original: khams bco brgyad po dag las gcod par byed pa ni gang gcad par bya ba ni gang /üîΩsreg par byed pa ni gang /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po dag las gcod par byed pa ni gang gcad par bya ba ni gang / sreg par byed pa ni gang /
translated: Among the eighteen elements, which are the cutting, that which is cut,

original: bsreg par bya ba ni gang /üîΩ'jal bar byed pa ni gang /üîΩgzhal bar bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba ni gang / 'jal bar byed pa ni gang / gzhal bar bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: the burning, that which is weighed,

original: gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
translated: the cutting, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //
translated: The cutting is the four external elements.

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cutting is the four external elements, i.e., the element of form, the element of smell, the element of taste, the element of tangibility.

original: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The axe, etc., are the cutting.

original: gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the factor called cutting?

original: 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o //
translated: It is the separation of the stream of aggregates which are produced in a continuous manner.

original: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The faculties of the body, etc., are not the cutting,

original: yan lag ma lus par bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: yan lag ma lus par bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro // dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med de /
translated: because, when the body is cut into many pieces, the faculties are not divided.

original: gcad pa'i yan lag la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcad pa'i yan lag la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculties are not divided, because the parts of the body which are cut off do not possess faculties.

original: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not the agent of cutting,

original: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are clear, like the light of a gem.üîΩJust as the four external elements are the object of cutting and the instrument of cutting,
