original: ji ltar gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid phyi rol gyi khams bzhi yin ba ltar de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid phyi rol gyi khams bzhi yin ba ltar de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal bar byed pa'o //
translated: so too are the four external elements the object of burning and the instrument of weighing.

original: de dag nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /
translated: They are the object of burning,

original: de dag nyid 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and they are the instrument of weighing.

original: dbang pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The sense-faculties are not the object of burning,

original: dang ba'i phyir 'od bzhin no //
analyzed: dang ba'i phyir 'od bzhin no //
translated: because they are clear, like light.

original: sgra yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra yang ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not the object of burning,

original: chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is discontinuous.

original: sreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //
analyzed: sreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //
translated: There is disagreement about burning and weighing.

original: kha cig na re ni khams bzhi po de dag nyid sreg par byed pa yang yin la /üîΩgzhal bar bya ba 'ang yin no zhes brjod do //üîΩkha cig na re ni me'i khams kho na sreg par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re ni khams bzhi po de dag nyid sreg par byed pa yang yin la / gzhal bar bya ba 'ang yin no zhes brjod do // kha cig na re ni me'i khams kho na sreg par byed pa yin la /
translated: Some say that the four external elements are the object of burning and the instrument of burning.üîΩSome say that the fire element is the object of burning and the instrument of burning.

original: lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that heaviness is the object of weighing and the instrument of weighing.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i khams rnams ni @44b du ;üîΩrgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i khams rnams ni @44b du ; rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many elements are born from ripening?üîΩHow many are born from development?

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are born from outflow?

original: rdzas dang ldan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: rdzas dang ldan pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are substantial?

original: skad cig pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are momentary?

original: smras pa / rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga //üîΩre zhig mig la sogs pa nang gi khams lnga po dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin la ;
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga // re zhig mig la sogs pa nang gi khams lnga po dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin la ;
translated: The five internal elements are born from ripening and from development.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: The five internal elements, i.e., the eye element, etc., are born from ripening and from development.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni med de /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni med de /
translated: They are not born from outflow,

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no outflow apart from them.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyas pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyas pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: That which is born from the cause of ripening is born from ripening,

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like a cart yoked to an ox.

original: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, action that has reached the time of its result is called retribution,

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the ripening.

original: de las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Those that arise from that are born of retribution.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin pas rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin pas rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The result is retribution itself, thus it is retribution.

original: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the result is figuratively designated as cause,

original: dper na 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as the cause is figuratively designated as result, as in the statement: ‚ÄúThese six sense-spheres of contact should be known as past karma.‚Äù

original: zas dang / legs par bya ba dang / gnyid log pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: zas dang / legs par bya ba dang / gnyid log pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Those that are developed by food, proper behavior, continence, and the special meditative attainment are born of development.

original: gzhan dag na re ni tshangs par spyod pas kyang rgyas par byed do zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni tshangs par spyod pas kyang rgyas par byed do zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that continence also develops.

original: des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi rgyas pa ni ma yin no //üîΩrgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la phyir bzhin du kun tu bsrung ngo //
analyzed: des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi rgyas pa ni ma yin no // rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la phyir bzhin du kun tu bsrung ngo //
translated: The sound of the voice is not nourished by the food of the sentient beings, but it is not without cause either.

original: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod kyi /
analyzed: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod kyi /
translated: The sound of the voice is nourished by the stream of the voice itself, which is nourished by the stream of the primary elements which is nourished by the stream of the primary elements of the body, which is nourished by the food of the sentient beings.üîΩSound is of two types:

original: sgra ni rnam smin las skyes min //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam smin las skyes min //
translated: Sound is not produced through retribution.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced at will.

original: 'o na gang bstan bcos btags pa las /
analyzed: 'o na gang bstan bcos btags pa las /
translated: But the Treatise on the Characteristics, in the chapter on the major marks, says:

original: tshig rtsub po spong ba shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i mtshan tshangs pa'i dbyangs nyid 'grub po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po spong ba shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i mtshan tshangs pa'i dbyangs nyid 'grub po zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mark of a great man called ‚ÄòBrahma‚Äôs voice‚Äô is produced by the cultivation of the avoidance of harsh words.‚Äù

original: kha cig na re ni brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te /üîΩlas dag las ni 'byung ba rnams 'grub /
analyzed: kha cig na re ni brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te / las dag las ni 'byung ba rnams 'grub /
translated: According to some, this mark is produced through a three-fold process:

original: 'byung ba rnams las ni sgra 'grub bo zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams las ni sgra 'grub bo zhes zer ro ;
translated: from action, the primary elements; from the primary elements, sound.

original: / kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: / kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni lnga pa yin te /
translated: According to others, this mark is produced through a five-fold process:

original: las dag las na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams 'grub /üîΩde dag las ni rgyas pa las byung ba rnams 'grub /
analyzed: las dag las na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams 'grub / de dag las ni rgyas pa las byung ba rnams 'grub /
translated: The primary elements that are the result of retribution arise from pure actions.üîΩThe primary elements that are the result of accumulation arise from the primary elements that are the result of retribution.

original: de dag las ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams 'grub bo //
analyzed: de dag las ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams 'grub bo //
translated: The primary elements that are the result of accumulation give rise to the primary elements that are the result of accumulation.

original: de dag las ni sgra 'grub po zhes zer ro //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni lus kyi @45a * //
analyzed: de dag las ni sgra 'grub po zhes zer ro // de lta na 'o na ni lus kyi @45a * //
translated: Sound arises from the primary elements that are the result of accumulation.

original: tshor ba yang las las skyes pa'i 'byung ba las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba yang las las skyes pa'i 'byung ba las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is the case, then bodily sensation would not be a ripened effect, since it arises from the primary elements that are the result of action.

original: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar gyur na rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar gyur na rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were in contradiction with reason, like sound, it would not be a ripened effect.üîΩThe primary elements that are the result of retribution give rise to the primary elements that are the result of accumulation.üîΩThe primary elements that are the result of accumulation give rise to the primary elements that are the result of accumulation.

original: rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
translated: The primary elements that are the result of accumulation give rise to sound.

original: thogs pa med pa brgyad /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa brgyad /
translated: Eight are not impeded.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: Which eight?

original: sems kyi khams bdun dag dang / chos kyi khams te skal pa mnyam ba dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rgyu mthun ba las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dag dang / chos kyi khams te skal pa mnyam ba dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rgyu mthun ba las byung ba dag go //
translated: The seven elements of consciousness and the element of mental objects are the result of the cause of similar lot and the cause of universal because they are the result of accumulation.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
translated: Those that are generated by the cause of ripening are born from the cause of ripening.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba ni med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba ni med de /
translated: There is no augmentation.

original: thogs pa med pa rnams la rgyas pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams la rgyas pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is no augmentation of the unobstructed.

original: / gzhan rnam gsum /
analyzed: / gzhan rnam gsum /
translated: The others are of three types.

original: gzhan ni lhag ma bzhi po gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams dag ste /üîΩde dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes ba dag kyang yin /
analyzed: gzhan ni lhag ma bzhi po gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams dag ste / de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes ba dag kyang yin /
translated: The others are the remaining four elements: form, sound, smell, taste, and the tangible.üîΩThey are born from the cause of ripening,

original: rgyas pa las byung ba dag kyang yin /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba dag kyang yin /
translated: born from the cause of augmentation,

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kyang yin no //
translated: and born from the cause of natural outflow.

original: rdzas dang lhan cig /'dus ma byas ni brtan pa'i phyir rdzas so //
analyzed: rdzas dang lhan cig /'dus ma byas ni brtan pa'i phyir rdzas so //
translated: The last is substantial. The unconditioned is substantial because it is stable.

original: de yang chos kyi khams la yod pas de'i phyir chos kyi khams gcig pu rdzas dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi khams la yod pas de'i phyir chos kyi khams gcig pu rdzas dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Since it exists in the phenomena element, therefore the phenomena element alone is substantial.

original: tha ma gsum skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: tha ma gsum skad cig ma ste /
translated: The last three are momentary.

original: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni 'don pa'i rim pas tha ma dag yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni 'don pa'i rim pas tha ma dag yin te /
translated: The mental element, the entity element, and the mental consciousness element are the last because of the order of enumeration.

original: de dag ni zag pa med pa'i bzod pa'i dang po sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni zag pa med pa'i bzod pa'i dang po sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: They are not derived from the cause of natural outflow in the single moment of the collection of perseverance for the dharma of suffering that is the first uncontaminated perseverance.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called moments.

original: 'dus byas gzhan ni rgyu mthun ba las ma byung ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas gzhan ni rgyu mthun ba las ma byung ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no other conditioned phenomenon that is not derived from natural outflow.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no //
translated: In this regard, the mind that is concomitant with perseverance for the dharma of suffering is the mental element and the mental consciousness element.

original: lhag ma de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: lhag ma de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The remaining factors that arise simultaneously with it are the entity element.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: gang gis mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa las ldan pa 'thob pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yang yin nam /
analyzed: gang gis mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa las ldan pa 'thob pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yang yin nam /
translated: Is one who obtains the eye element that was not possessed also one who obtains the eye consciousness element?

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yin pa de mig gi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yin pa de mig gi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is one who obtains the eye consciousness element also one who obtains the eye element?

original: smras pa / mig dang ni /
analyzed: smras pa / mig dang ni /
translated: It is said:üîΩThere is acquisition of the eye element

original: rnam shes khams dag so so dang // lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod //
analyzed: rnam shes khams dag so so dang // lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod //
translated: and the eye consciousness element individually and together.

original: re zhig so so ni mig gi khams dang yin la /
analyzed: re zhig so so ni mig gi khams dang yin la /
translated: First, there is acquisition of the eye element individually.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: One is not one who obtains the eye consciousness element.

original: 'dod @45b pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob pa dang / gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na'o //
analyzed: 'dod @45b pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob pa dang / gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na'o //
translated: One who obtains the eye element in the desire realm gradually and one who dies in the formless realm and is born in the second absorption and so on.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: One is not one who obtains the eye element but one who obtains the eye consciousness element.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa dang / de dag nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa dang / de dag nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o //
translated: It is also when one manifests eye consciousness arisen in the second absorption and so on and when one dies in those absorptions and is reborn in a lower level.

original: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: It is also when both exist simultaneously.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
translated: It is also when one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm or the world of Brahma.

original: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is not when both do not exist, which is when those instances are excluded.

original: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who possesses the eye element also one who possesses eye consciousness?

original: mu bzhi ste /üîΩmu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi ste / mu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o //
translated: There are four possibilities.üîΩThe first possibility is when one is born in the second absorption and so on and does not manifest eye consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig ma thob ba dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig ma thob ba dang nyams pa'o //
translated: The second possibility is when one has not obtained the eye sense faculty or it degenerates in the desire realm.

original: gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig gi thob pa dang ma nyams pa dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig gi thob pa dang ma nyams pa dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The third is the acquisition and non-abandonment of the eye element in the desire realm, and the arising of the first absorption.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the exception of the above cases.

original: de bzhin du mig gi khams dang gzugs dag dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / gzugs dag 'thob pa dang ldan ba dag kyang ci rigs par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi khams dang gzugs dag dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / gzugs dag 'thob pa dang ldan ba dag kyang ci rigs par brtag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the acquisition and possession of the eye element and form element, and the eye consciousness element and form element should be examined as appropriate.

original: lhan cig tu yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni zhar la 'ongs pa 'di bsdu ba'i don to //üîΩkhams du dag gcig ni nang gi yin /
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni zhar la 'ongs pa 'di bsdu ba'i don to // khams du dag gcig ni nang gi yin /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúalso together‚Äù has the meaning of including what is incidental.üîΩHow many elements are internal?

original: du dag gcig ni phyi'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: du dag gcig ni phyi'i yin zhe na /
translated: How many are external?

original: nang gi bcu gnyis /
analyzed: nang gi bcu gnyis /
translated: Twelve are internal.

original: bcu gnyis gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang dag ce na /
translated: Which twelve?

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs rnam par shes pa drug dang / rten drug ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs rnam par shes pa drug dang / rten drug ste /
translated: The six consciousnesses, excluding form and so on, and the six supports.

original: khams bcu gnyis po de dag ni nang gi yin no //
analyzed: khams bcu gnyis po de dag ni nang gi yin no //
translated: These twelve elements are internal.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams drug po de dag ni phyi'i yin no //üîΩbdag med na ji ltar na nang gi 'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams drug po de dag ni phyi'i yin no // bdag med na ji ltar na nang gi 'am /
translated: The six sense spheres of form, etc., are external.

original: phyi'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no self, how can they be internal or external?

original: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir bdag ces nye bar 'dogs te /üîΩmkhas pas bdag nyid shin tu ni ;
analyzed: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir bdag ces nye bar 'dogs te / mkhas pas bdag nyid shin tu ni ;
translated: The mind is designated as the self because it is the support of the conception of self.üîΩThe wise attain heaven

original: / dul bas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs la /
analyzed: / dul bas mtho ris thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs la /
translated: through complete self-discipline.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las /
translated: The Bhagav√•n has said in another s≈´tra:

original: sems dul ba ni legs pa ste /
analyzed: sems dul ba ni legs pa ste /
translated: A disciplined mind is excellent.

original: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren //üîΩzhes sems dul ba yan par gsungs pas de'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni sems bdag tu gyur pa'i rten gyi dngos por nye bar gyur @46a * //
analyzed: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren // zhes sems dul ba yan par gsungs pas de'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni sems bdag tu gyur pa'i rten gyi dngos por nye bar gyur @46a * //
translated: A disciplined mind leads to happiness.

original: pa'i phyir nang gi nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir nang gi nyid yin no //
translated: Since the Bhagav√•n has said that a disciplined mind is excellent, the eye, etc., are internal because they are the basis of the self, i.e., the mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni yul du gyur pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni yul du gyur pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi nyid yin no //
translated: Form, etc., are external because they are objects.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag nang gi yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag nang gi yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the six sense spheres of consciousness are not internal.

original: de dag yid kyi khams nyid du ma gyur pa ni sems kyi rten du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag yid kyi khams nyid du ma gyur pa ni sems kyi rten du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are not the mental faculty itself, they cannot be the basis of the mind.

original: gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe na yang de dag nyid de dag yin te mtshan nyid las ni mi 'da'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe na yang de dag nyid de dag yin te mtshan nyid las ni mi 'da'o //
translated: But when they are the mental faculty, they are the mental faculty, and they do not go beyond their intrinsic nature.

original: de lta ma yin na yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yin par ni mi 'gyur ba zhig na khams bco brgyad po dag ni dus gsum pa yin par yang 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yin par ni mi 'gyur ba zhig na khams bco brgyad po dag ni dus gsum pa yin par yang 'dod do //
translated: Otherwise, the mental faculty would be past only, and not future or present, but the eighteen elements are accepted as being in the three times.

original: gal te yang rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur na 'das pa'i dus na yang yid kyi khams su rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur na 'das pa'i dus na yang yid kyi khams su rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If future and present consciousness were not the intrinsic nature of the mental faculty, then the mental faculty would not be established in the past,

original: mtshan nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do //
translated: because the intrinsic nature of something does not change over time.

original: brten pa dang bcas pa'i khams rnams ni du /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas pa'i khams rnams ni du /
translated: Which elements are associated with support?

original: de dang mtshungs pa rnams ni du zhe na /üîΩre zhig gcig tu /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa rnams ni du zhe na /üîΩre zhig gcig tu /
translated: Which are similar to those?üîΩFirst, those that are exclusively associated with support are the ten physical elements.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term phenomena refers to

original: brten pa dang bcas /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas /
translated: that which is possessed.

original: gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du nges la gal te de la rnam par shes pa de skyes pa 'am skyes pa'i chos can gyi yul de ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya la /üîΩgang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khams gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du nges la gal te de la rnam par shes pa de skyes pa 'am skyes pa'i chos can gyi yul de ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya la / gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khams gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: That which is ascertained as the object of a certain consciousness, if that object generates that consciousness or is the type that can generate that consciousness, it is called possessed.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni gdon mi za bar chos thams cad la bdag med do snyam pa'i sems 'di skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni gdon mi za bar chos thams cad la bdag med do snyam pa'i sems 'di skye'o //
translated: There is no dharma element whatsoever that is not the object of the limitless mental consciousness that has arisen or will arise, because all ƒÅrya beings definitely generate the mind that thinks all phenomena are selfless.

original: de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs pa chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs pa chos thams cad yin no //
translated: Moreover, all phenomena are its object except for its intrinsic state and its coexistent states.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma de yang sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan gyi dmigs pa ma yin pas skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma de yang sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan gyi dmigs pa ma yin pas skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur te /
translated: Since that moment of mind is not the object of another moment of mind, all phenomena are the object of two moments of mind.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag tu brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag tu brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus the element of factors is always associated with support.

original: lhag ma ni /
analyzed: lhag ma ni /
translated: The rest

original: de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin /
translated: are also similar to that.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni brten pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni brten pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin pa'o //
translated: The word also indicates that they are also associated with support.

original: de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is meant by similar to that?

original: gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
translated: That which does not perform its function

original: gang rang gi las byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rang gi las byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is said to be associated with support.

original: de la mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong ba dang / lta ba 'am lta bar 'gyur ba'i mig de ni brten pa dang bcas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong ba dang / lta ba 'am lta bar 'gyur ba'i mig de ni brten pa dang bcas zhes bya ste /
translated: The eye that sees visible form, or the eye that is the basis of seeing or will be the basis of seeing is said to be associated with support.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar @46b la yang rang rang gi yul la byed pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar @46b la yang rang rang gi yul la byed pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the ear and so on up to the mind.

original: kha che ba rnams kyi ltar na de dang mtshungs pa'i mig ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams kyi ltar na de dang mtshungs pa'i mig ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: According to the Kashmiri Vaibhasikas, the eye that is similar to that is of four types.

original: gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gags pa dang / 'gag pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gags pa dang / 'gag pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos gang yin ba'o //
translated: The form that has ceased without having been seen, that which is ceasing, that which will cease, and that which is not produced.

original: nub phyogs pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam pa lnga ste ;
analyzed: nub phyogs pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam pa lnga ste ;
translated: According to the Westerners, there are five types:

original: mi skye ba'i chos de nyid rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos de nyid rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i phyir te /
translated: the same as above, except that the factor not yet arisen is divided into two categories: that which is associated with consciousness and that which is not associated with consciousness.

original: lus kyi bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the other sense-faculties up to and including the body.

original: yid ni mi skye ba'i chos kho na de 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: yid ni mi skye ba'i chos kho na de 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The mental faculty is only of the type that is not yet arisen.

original: gzugs gang dag mig gis mthong bar gyur pa dang / mthong ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs gang dag mig gis mthong bar gyur pa dang / mthong ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The form that has been seen by the eye, that which is being seen, that which will be seen, that which is suitable to be seen, that which is associated with the eye, that which is not disassociated from the eye, that which is related to the eye, that which is not unrelated to the eye, that which is included in the eye, that which is not excluded from the eye‚Äîall that is called ‚Äúthat which is related to the eye.‚Äù

original: de dang 'dra ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The form that is similar to that is of four types:

original: gang dag ma mthong ba nyid du 'gags pa dang / 'gag pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag mi skye ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: gang dag ma mthong ba nyid du 'gags pa dang / 'gag pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag mi skye ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: that which has ceased without having been seen, that which is ceasing, that which will cease, and that which is not produced.

original: de bzhin du reg bya'i bar dag la yang rang gi dbang po'i byed pas de dang 'dra ba dag tu rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya'i bar dag la yang rang gi dbang po'i byed pas de dang 'dra ba dag tu rig par bya'o ;
translated: The same holds for the other sense-faculties up to the tactile sense-faculty.

original: / gcig gi mig brten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin no //
analyzed: / gcig gi mig brten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin no //
translated: The eye sense-faculty, when it is the sense-faculty of one person, is not the sense-faculty of another person.

original: de dang mtshungs pa rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The same holds for the other sense-faculties up to the tactile sense-faculty.

original: yid kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yid kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The mental faculty is also like this.

original: gzugs ni gang zhig lta ba de'i brten pa dang bcas pa yin la gang mi lta ba de'i ni de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni gang zhig lta ba de'i brten pa dang bcas pa yin la gang mi lta ba de'i ni de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The visible form that is the object of the visual consciousness of one person is the object of the visual consciousness of another person.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzugs gang la gcig lta ba de la mang po yang lta bar 'gyur ba srid pa yod de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs gang la gcig lta ba de la mang po yang lta bar 'gyur ba srid pa yod de /
translated: Why is this?

original: dper na zla ba dang bro gar dang gyad dag la lta ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zla ba dang bro gar dang gyad dag la lta ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is possible that many people can look at the same object, such as the moon, a dance, or a wrestler.

original: gang gnyis mig gcig gis lta bar 'gyur ba srid pa ni med de /
analyzed: gang gnyis mig gcig gis lta bar 'gyur ba srid pa ni med de /
translated: But it is not possible for two people to look with the same eye.

original: de'i phyir 'di thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig gi dbang gis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig gi dbang gis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the eye sense-faculty is determined on the basis of a single stream of consciousness, because it is not shared.

original: gzugs ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir rgyud ma'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag go / gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams dag la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir rgyud ma'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag go / gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams dag la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects should be understood in the same way as form.

original: sgra ni de lta yin du chug na dri la sogs pa ni gang dag gcig gis 'dzin pa de dag gzhan gyis mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: sgra ni de lta yin du chug na dri la sogs pa ni gang dag gcig gis 'dzin pa de dag gzhan gyis mi 'dzin te /
translated: Granted that sound is like that, but one person does not apprehend the smell, etc., that another person apprehends.

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are apprehended by contact.

original: de lta bas na de dag kyang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa bzhin du bsgre ba'i rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag kyang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa bzhin du bsgre ba'i rigs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, like the eye and so on, smell, etc., are not homogeneous causes because they are not homogeneous.

original: de lta bu yod mod kyi 'on kyang de dag la yang srid pa'i phyir thun mong ba nyid de /
analyzed: de lta bu yod mod kyi 'on kyang de dag la yang srid pa'i phyir thun mong ba nyid de /
translated: Granted that this is so, but they are homogeneous because it is possible that they are homogeneous.

original: gcig gis sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzhan dag gi yang yin pa srid pa de ni yod kyi mig la @47a * //
analyzed: gcig gis sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzhan dag gi yang yin pa srid pa de ni yod kyi mig la @47a * //
translated: It is possible that the smell, etc., that generate nose consciousness, etc., of one person are also those of another. This is not so for the eye sense faculty.

original: sogs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the other elements are not like the eye.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni gzugs bzhin du bsgre'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni gzugs bzhin du bsgre'o //
translated: Therefore, they are like form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag gi brten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid ni skye ba dang mi skye ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir yid kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag gi brten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid ni skye ba dang mi skye ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir yid kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the mind element‚Äù means that the eye consciousness element and the other consciousness elements are like the mind element in being both supported and similar.

original: brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na ;üîΩdbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun brten pa 'am /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na ; dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun brten pa 'am /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúsupported‚Äù?üîΩThe eye, form, and eye consciousness mutually support each other.

original: byed pa la brten pa ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa la brten pa ni brten pa'o //
translated: Or, they are supported by the action of supporting.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas brten pa dang bcas pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas brten pa dang bcas pa rnams sam /
translated: Since they possess this support, they are said to be supported.

original: 'bras bu reg pa 'dra ba'i phyir brten pa mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu reg pa 'dra ba'i phyir brten pa mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Or, they are similar in that they have contact as their result.

original: gang dag brten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa de dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa de dag dang rigs 'dra ba'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs pa dag go //
analyzed: gang dag brten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa de dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa de dag dang rigs 'dra ba'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs pa dag go //
translated: Those that are not supported are similar to those that are supported because they are of the same type.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du /
translated: How many elements are to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are to be abandoned by the path of meditation?

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not to be abandoned?

original: re zhig gzugs can bcu ni bsgoms pas spang bya yin /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs can bcu ni bsgoms pas spang bya yin /
translated: Ten are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: lnga yang yin te rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag go / tha ma'i gsum rnam gsum /
analyzed: lnga yang yin te rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag go / tha ma'i gsum rnam gsum /
translated: Five are also objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThe last three are of three types.

original: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang khams gsum po 'di dag ni rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang khams gsum po 'di dag ni rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: The three elements of the mental faculty, phenomena and mental consciousness are of three types.üîΩThe eighty-eight negative tendencies,

original: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang // de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de dag gi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang // de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de dag gi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: those that arise simultaneously with them and the obtainment of those that arise simultaneously with them and their obtainment are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma rnams ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma rnams ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: The remaining contaminated elements are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag go //
translated: The uncontaminated factors are not to be abandoned.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan yang yod ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan yang yod ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But aren‚Äôt there other factors to be abandoned by seeing that are not the truth of suffering, such as the nature of an ordinary person and the bodily and verbal actions of those in the lower realms, because they are incompatible with the noble path?

original: de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not to be abandoned by seeing.

original: mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the summary:

original: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
translated: That which is neither afflicted nor uncontaminated is not to be abandoned by seeing.

original: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
analyzed: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
translated: That which is not form and is not derived from the sixth is not to be abandoned by seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la gzugs kyang ma yin no//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la gzugs kyang ma yin no//
translated: There is not even a small part of that which is neither afflicted nor uncontaminated that is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: The nature of an ordinary person is neither afflicted nor neutral,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who have severed their wholesome roots and those who are free from attachment possess it.

original: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin no //
translated: Bodily and vocal action are form.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus they are not susceptible to being abandoned by insight.

original: bden pa dag la log par @47b mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dag la log par @47b mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: For, in the realm of desire, one does not falsely conceive the truths, and, in the state of receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to suffering, one is no longer an ordinary man.

original: drug pa las ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: drug pa las ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not produced by the sixth,

original: drug pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: drug pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: the sixth is the mental faculty.

original: de las gzhan pa las skyes pa ni drug pa las ma skyes pa ste /üîΩdbang po lnga las skyes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las skyes pa ni drug pa las ma skyes pa ste / dbang po lnga las skyes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is produced by another is not produced by the sixth.

original: de yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: de yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni med do //
translated: That which is produced by the five sense faculties is not susceptible to being abandoned by insight.

original: khams bco brgyad po dag las lta ba ni du /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po dag las lta ba ni du /
translated: The eighteen elements are as follows:üîΩHow many of them are views?

original: lta ba ma yin pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba ma yin pa ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not views?

original: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni /
analyzed: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni /
translated: The eye and part of the element of factors

original: lta ba yin te /
analyzed: lta ba yin te /
translated: are views.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that part?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / rnam pa brgyad /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa brgyad /
translated: Eight types.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa la lta ba lnga dag dang / 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ; slob pa'i lta ba dang / mi slob pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa la lta ba lnga dag dang / 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ; slob pa'i lta ba dang / mi slob pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The five views such as the view of the transitory collection, mundane right view, the view of the trainee, and the view of the non-trainee.

original: chos kyi khams rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag ni lta ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi khams rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag ni lta ba yin no //
translated: These eight types of the phenomena element are view.

original: lhag ma ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The remainder are not view.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ni phra rgyas bstan par ston pa'i dus la 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ni phra rgyas bstan par ston pa'i dus la 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection and so on will be explained in the section on the contaminants.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //üîΩslob pa'i zag pa med pa'i lta ba ni slob pa'i 'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o // slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i lta ba ni slob pa'i 'o //
translated: Mundane right view is the contaminated virtue of wisdom concomitant with mental consciousness.üîΩThe uncontaminated view of the trainee is the view of the trainee.

original: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i 'o //
translated: The uncontaminated view of the non-trainee is the view of the non-trainee.

original: sprin dang bcas pa dang sprin med pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo gzugs la lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos la lta ba'o //
analyzed: sprin dang bcas pa dang sprin med pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo gzugs la lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos la lta ba'o //
translated: The world views things as it does the forms seen at night in a cloud or without a cloud, or as it does the forms seen in the daytime with or without a cloud.üîΩWhy is right worldly view called worldly?üîΩBecause it is associated with the five consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is not associated with it.üîΩThe mental consciousness is not associated with it, because it is not associated with the five consciousnesses.

original: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar / rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya zhe na / 'di ltar / rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
translated: The five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.

original: nges rtog med phyir lta ma yin //üîΩrtog par byed pa ni lta ba yin te /
analyzed: nges rtog med phyir lta ma yin // rtog par byed pa ni lta ba yin te /
translated: The five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.

original: nges par sems pa la zhugs pa dag lta ba yin na rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩde lta bas na 'di ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par sems pa la zhugs pa dag lta ba yin na rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩde lta bas na 'di ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The five consciousnesses are not associated with it, because they are not associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five consciousnesses

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can nam nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gzhan yang lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can nam nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gzhan yang lta ba ma yin no //
translated: Consequently, other forms of defiled or nondefiled discernment are not views.

original: 'o na ni mig kyang rtog par byed pa nyid med na /
analyzed: 'o na ni mig kyang rtog par byed pa nyid med na /
translated: But if the eye does not have the nature of a thinker,

original: ji ltar lta ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lta ba yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be a seer?

original: gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te /
analyzed: gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te /
translated: It is a seer in the sense that it sees visible form.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For it is said:

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong /
translated: The eye sees visible form.

original: gal te mig gis mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mig gis mthong bar gyur na /
translated: If the eye sees,

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: then one who possesses another consciousness would also see.

original: mig thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: But it is not the case that everything that has an eye sees.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩbrten bcas / gang gi tshe rnam @48a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / brten bcas / gang gi tshe rnam @48a * //
translated: What then?

original: par shes pa dang bcas pa de'i cho mthong gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par shes pa dang bcas pa de'i cho mthong gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When it is associated with consciousness, it sees, not otherwise.

original: de lta na 'o na ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa de kho nas mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa de kho nas mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then only the consciousness that is associated with the eye sees.

original: de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes nges par bya bar nus pa ni min no //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes nges par bya bar nus pa ni min no //
translated: But it cannot be said that the consciousness that is based on it sees.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ni mthong ba min phyir lo //
analyzed: gzugs ni mthong ba min phyir lo //
translated: Because a form that is obstructed is not seen.

original: gang gi phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes grag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that a form that is obstructed by a wall and so on is not seen.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong bar gyur na de ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa la yang thogs pa med pas gzugs bsgribs pa la yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong bar gyur na de ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa la yang thogs pa med pas gzugs bsgribs pa la yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If seeing were to be done by consciousness, then since consciousness is not obstructed, it would see even a form that is obstructed by a wall and so on.

original: bsgribs pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: bsgribs pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid de /
translated: But the visual consciousness does not arise in regard to an obstructed form.

original: de bas na ma skyes pas ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na ma skyes pas ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it does not arise, how can it see?

original: ci ste mi skye /
analyzed: ci ste mi skye /
translated: If you say that it does not arise,

original: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong ba de'i ltar na ni mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgribs pa la 'jug pa med pas rnam par shes pa yang rten dang lhan cig tu yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir mi skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong ba de'i ltar na ni mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgribs pa la 'jug pa med pas rnam par shes pa yang rten dang lhan cig tu yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir mi skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: But if you maintain that the eye sees, then since the eye is obstructed, it does not engage with the obstructed object. Therefore, it is not possible that consciousness does not arise because the eye and its support engage with the same object.

original: mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du yul de phrad pa zhig yin nam ci na /
analyzed: mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du yul de phrad pa zhig yin nam ci na /
translated: Is the eye like the body faculty in that it contacts its object?

original: 'di ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang shel dang chu dag gis bar du chod pa yang ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang shel dang chu dag gis bar du chod pa yang ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If so, then how could the eye see an obstructed object, since it is obstructed because it has resistance? How could it see an object that is distant, since it does not contact it?

original: de lta bas na mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gzugs bsgribs pa mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gzugs bsgribs pa mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that the eye does not see an obstructed object because it is obstructed.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then how does it see?

original: gang la snang ba la gegs med na gzugs bsgribs bzhin du yang de la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang la snang ba la gegs med na gzugs bsgribs bzhin du yang de la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin la /
translated: If there is no obstruction to the appearance of an object, then even if the object is obstructed, eye consciousness arises with respect to it.

original: gang la gegs yod pa de ni mi skye bas ma skyes pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la gegs yod pa de ni mi skye bas ma skyes pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Since that which is obstructed does not arise, it is not seen because it is unarisen.

original: 'o na gang mdo las /
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las /
translated: But if that is so, then why does a sutra declare:

original: gang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen forms with the eye,‚Äù

original: der ni dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: der ni dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning there is ‚Äúhaving relied on that.‚Äù

original: dper na yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩyid ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dper na yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // yid ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: For example, it is like the statement: ‚ÄúHaving cognized phenomena with the mind.‚ÄùüîΩThe mind does not cognize phenomena

original: chos rnams rnam par mi shes so //
analyzed: chos rnams rnam par mi shes so //
translated: because it is past.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then how is it that the sutras declare:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving cognized phenomena with the mind‚Äù?

original: yang na brten pa'i las brten la nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na brten pa'i las brten la nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the action of the support is figuratively designated to the supported,

original: dper na khri'u dag 'bod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khri'u dag 'bod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the statement: ‚ÄúThe chairs cry out.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las /
translated: How is it that a sutra declares:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i gzugs yid du 'ong ba sdug pa rnams zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i gzugs yid du 'ong ba sdug pa rnams zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen forms with the eye that are agreeable and attractive,‚Äù

original: de dag mig gis rnam par mi shes so /
analyzed: de dag mig gis rnam par mi shes so /
translated: since the eye does not cognize?

original: mdo las / bram ze @48b mig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdo las / bram ze @48b mig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: A sutra declares:

original: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no zhes kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no zhes kyang gsungs te /
translated: Brahmin, the eye is the door for the seeing of forms.

original: de'i phyir mig gi sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the eye sees form by means of eye consciousness.

original: der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do //
analyzed: der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do //
translated: In that sutra, the eye is the door for seeing.

original: mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the eye sees form.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na gang gis rnam par shes she na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na gang gis rnam par shes she na /
translated: If consciousness sees, by what is consciousness itself seen?

original: 'di gnyis la khyad par yang ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la khyad par yang ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: gang gis gzugs rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis 'di mi mthong mod /üîΩdper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong zhes kyang bya /üîΩrab tu shes pa zhes kyang bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gis gzugs rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis 'di mi mthong mod / dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong zhes kyang bya / rab tu shes pa zhes kyang bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: That which sees form is consciousness.üîΩFor example, some say that wisdom sees and some say that it is understanding.

original: rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig la mthong zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig la mthong zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: In the same way, some say that consciousness sees.üîΩBut others say that consciousness is that which is aware.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: and also consciousness.

original: gzhan dag na re ni gal te mig gis mthong na mig byed pa por gyur pa'i lta ba'i bya ba gzhan gang zhig yin pa brjod dgos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni gal te mig gis mthong na mig byed pa por gyur pa'i lta ba'i bya ba gzhan gang zhig yin pa brjod dgos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: If the eye sees, then it must be said that there is another action of seeing that is the action of the eye as agent.

original: de ni klan kar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni klan kar mi rung ste /
translated: This is not a criticism.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pas shas so zhes bya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pas shas so zhes bya bar 'dod la /
translated: Just as it is accepted that consciousness cognizes,

original: de la byed pa po dang bya ba'i bye brag kyang med pa de bzhin du 'di la yang rung bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de la byed pa po dang bya ba'i bye brag kyang med pa de bzhin du 'di la yang rung bar 'gyur ro /
translated: and there is no distinction of agent and action in that, so it is here.

original: gzhan dag na re ni mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: Others say: Seeing is the eye consciousness.

original: mig ni de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig ni de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The eye is said to see because it is the basis of that.

original: dper na sgrogs ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir dril sgrogs sa zhas bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na sgrogs ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir dril sgrogs sa zhas bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, a bell is said to sound because it is the basis of the sound.

original: de ltar na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur ba'i phyir rnam par shes so zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur ba'i phyir rnam par shes so zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, because the eye is the basis of eye consciousness, would it not be the consciousness that sees?

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: No, it does not follow that the eye sees.

original: 'jig rten na rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes grags te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes grags te /
translated: In the world, it is consciousness that is known as seeing.

original: 'di ltar de skyes na gzugs mthong ngo zhes zer gyi rnam par shes so zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de skyes na gzugs mthong ngo zhes zer gyi rnam par shes so zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: For when it arises, one says that visible form is seen, not that visible form is cognized.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang /
translated: The VibhƒÅ·π£ƒÅ says:

original: mig dang phrad cing rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba la mthong ba zhes bya ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig dang phrad cing rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba la mthong ba zhes bya ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said that seeing is that which is in contact with the eye and is experienced by consciousness.

original: de lta bas na mig gis mthong ba kho na zhes bya'i /üîΩrnam par shes pa zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig gis mthong ba kho na zhes bya'i / rnam par shes pa zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is the eye that sees, not consciousness.üîΩBut, in fact, it is consciousness that sees, not the eye,

original: rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes pas so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes pas so zhes bya ste /
translated: for it is said that visible form is cognized by the consciousness of the eye.

original: dper na nyi mas nyin par byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi mas nyin par byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as one says that the sun makes the day,

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re ni nam mkha' ldan pa 'dis ci dgos //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re ni nam mkha' ldan pa 'dis ci dgos //
translated: What is the use of this theory of the ƒÄbhidhƒÅrmikas?

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de la lta ba ni su zhig yin /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de la lta ba ni su zhig yin /
translated: Who is it that sees when the visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and visible forms?

original: lta ba ni gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: lta ba ni gang zhig yin te /
translated: What is the view?

original: 'di ni byed pa med pa dang chos tsam dang rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad la /üîΩde la yang tha snyad du gdags pa'i don du 'dun pa'i sgo nas mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa med pa dang chos tsam dang rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad la / de la yang tha snyad du gdags pa'i don du 'dun pa'i sgo nas mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: This is only the absence of agent, the mere phenomenon, cause and effect.

original: rnam @49a * //
analyzed: rnam @49a * //
translated: And in order to designate conventionally, one says, ‚ÄúThe eye sees by way of desire.‚Äù

original: par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not insist on this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúOne should not insist on the words of the people of the country.

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la mngon par brgyug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la mngon par brgyug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: One should not run after the names of the world.‚Äù

original: mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: The eye sees.

original: rna bas thos so /üîΩsnas tshor ro //
analyzed: rna bas thos so / snas tshor ro //
translated: The ear hears.üîΩThe nose smells.

original: lces myong ngo //
analyzed: lces myong ngo //
translated: The tongue tastes.

original: lus kyis reg go / yid kyis rnam par shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis reg go / yid kyis rnam par shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: The body touches. The mind cognizes. This is the tenet of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: ci mig gcig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam /
analyzed: ci mig gcig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam /
translated: Does one eye see forms or both eyes?

original: 'on te gnyi gas she na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi gas she na /
translated: But if the eye sensefaculty sees, and if the mental faculty also sees, why is it said that visible form is seen by the eye sensefaculty?

original: 'di la nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la nges pa med do //
translated: There is no rule here.

original: mig ni gnyi ga dag gis kyang //
analyzed: mig ni gnyi ga dag gis kyang //
translated: The eye sensefaculty sees, and so does the mental faculty,

original: mthong ste gsal bar mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ste gsal bar mthong phyir ro //
translated: for it is said that one sees clearly when the two cooperate.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re mig gnyi gas kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re mig gnyi gas kyang mthong ste /
translated: The ƒÄbhidhƒÅrmikas say that the eye sensefaculty and the mental faculty see.

original: 'di ltar gnyi ga phye na gsal bar rab tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyi ga phye na gsal bar rab tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For, when the two cooperate, one sees clearly.

original: mig gcig phye la gnyis pa phyed phye na zla ba gnyis su 'dzin gyi gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na nim yin no //
analyzed: mig gcig phye la gnyis pa phyed phye na zla ba gnyis su 'dzin gyi gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na nim yin no //
translated: When one eye is open and the other half closed, one sees two moons, but not when one eye is open and the other is completely closed.

original: rten rnam par chad par thal bar yang med de /
analyzed: rten rnam par chad par thal bar yang med de /
translated: The eye sensefaculty is not cut off from its objectfield,

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs bzhin du yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs bzhin du yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: for the consciousness does not reside in the objectfield, as does material form.

original: gal te mig gis mthong ba dang rna bas thos pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yin na ci 'di dag yul dang phrad pa zhig gam /üîΩ'on te ma phrad pa zhig yin zhe na /üîΩmig dang yid dang rna ba ni ;
analyzed: gal te mig gis mthong ba dang rna bas thos pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yin na ci 'di dag yul dang phrad pa zhig gam / 'on te ma phrad pa zhig yin zhe na / mig dang yid dang rna ba ni ;
translated: If the eye sensefaculty sees, if the ear sensefaculty hears, if the mental faculty cognizes, do these sensefaculties attain their objectfield or not?üîΩThe sensefaculties are of two types:

original: yul dang ma phrad /
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad /
translated: The eye sensefaculty, the ear sensefaculty and the mental faculty do not attain their objectfield.

original: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhing mig la yod pa'i mig sman mi mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhing mig la yod pa'i mig sman mi mthong la /
translated: In the same way, one sees visible form at a distance, but not the eye ointment which is on the eye.

original: de bzhin du sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so //
translated: In the same way, one hears sounds at a distance.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid cig yin na ni 'di na bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang / rna ba skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid cig yin na ni 'di na bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang / rna ba skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the visual consciousness were to arise in relation to an object with which the eye is in contact, then the divine eye and ear would not arise in the realm of meditation,

original: sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the nose, etc.

original: gal te mig yul dang ma phrad pa yin na ci'i phyir thag ring ba dang bar du chod pa ma phrad pa thams cad mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig yul dang ma phrad pa yin na ci'i phyir thag ring ba dang bar du chod pa ma phrad pa thams cad mi mthong zhe na /
translated: If the eye sees without coming into contact with its object, why does it not see things that are distant or obscured?

original: re zhig khab long gis kyang lcags ma phrad pa thams cad ji ltar mi 'dren /
analyzed: re zhig khab long gis kyang lcags ma phrad pa thams cad ji ltar mi 'dren /
translated: Why does a magnet not attract all iron?

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid cig yin na yang ci'i phyir mig sman nam thur ma phrad pa thams cad mi mthong ste de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid cig yin na yang ci'i phyir mig sman nam thur ma phrad pa thams cad mi mthong ste de ni mtshungs so //
translated: If the visual consciousness arises in relation to an object with which the eye is in contact, why does it not see the eye ointment or the spoon?

original: ji ltar yang sna la sogs pa yul dang phrad pa yin yang lhan ci skyes pa'i dri la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yang sna la sogs pa yul dang phrad pa yin yang lhan ci skyes pa'i dri la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, although the nose, etc. are in contact with their object-fields, they do not grasp the odor, etc. which is simultaneous with them.

original: mig kyang ma phrad pa yin mod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig kyang ma phrad pa yin mod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye is not in contact with its object-field, but it is not the case that it does not grasp its object-field when it is not in contact with it.

original: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa nyid du mi nus so //üîΩyang kha cig ni rna ba'i nang du yang sgra thos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa nyid du mi nus so // yang kha cig ni rna ba'i nang du yang sgra thos pa'i phyir /
translated: The mental faculty, being non-material, cannot be in contact.

original: rna ba @49b ni yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yang yin par sems so //üîΩlhag ma sna dang lce dang lus zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rna ba @49b ni yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yang yin par sems so // lhag ma sna dang lce dang lus zhes bya ba /
